Impact: He was sidelined on Tuesday, but is good to go tonight. Adjust your lineup accordingly.
News: Mike Bibby (toe) will be active on Wednesday when Atlanta takes on the Pistons, according to the Atlanta Journal-Constitution.

Impact: It looks like the Hawks are going to go with a bigger lineup, with Collins, Josh Smith and Al Horford all in the starting five. Don't worry about adding Collins until we see how this new configuration plays out.
News: Collins will start Monday against Orlando, the Atlanta Journal-Constitution reports.

Impact: Crawford certainly figures to see increased usage with Johnson out for the next two months or so. Atlanta has a four-game week coming up, making Crawford particularly valuable.
News: With Joe Johnson (elbow) out of Wednesday's contest versus Memphis, Crawford saw a slight increase in minutes (by about four) and shots (by about five or six) over his season averages.

Impact: The rookie first-round pick didn't shoot well, but if the other Hawks continue to struggle, he could see more playing time in the near future.
News: Crawford took a team-high 14 shots and made three for 10 points in a 99-76 loss to Boston on Monday night.

Impact: Evans played 21 minutes in a close game and without any sort of foul trouble -- all of which suggests he's not worth an add right now.
News: As anticipated, Evans joined the starting lineup with Joe Johnson (elbow) out. Perhaps also as anticipated, it was Jamal Crawford who benefited more directly from Johnson's absence.

Impact: The Hawks were forced to move some pieces around in their lineup when Joe Johnson went down with an elbow injury, and Horford's shift to power forward has paid immediate dividends. He's shouldering a larger offensive role and is averaging nearly 20 points per game over his last five.
News: Horford had 24 points (10-18 FG, 4-5 FT), 10 rebounds and six assists in Tuesday's win over the Nets.

Impact: Johnson will be able to begin his rehab Friday. Owners will have to do without him for four-to-six weeks. Mo Evans will start in Johnson's place, but Jamal Crawford figures to see the biggest boost in production.
News: Johnson underwent successful arthroscopic surgery on his right elbow Thursday, the Associated Press reports.

Impact: The words "team-high" and "Pachulia" are rarely seen in such close proximity. It's likely to be awhile before we see that again.
News: Pachulia had a team-high 16 points (6-7 FG, 4-6 FT) Wednesday night versus Milwaukee.

Impact: Powell appears to be playing some role in filling the vacuum left by Joe Johnson's (elbow) absence. He's not a must-have player at the moment, just someone to bump up in your mental rankings.
News: Powell had his second quality effort in three games, recording 12 points (5-10 FG, 2-2 FT) and six rebounds in 21 minutes off the bench.

Impact: Tuesday was Smith's first game of 20 or more points in his last seven.
News: Smith had a season-high 34 points on 14 of 16 shooting in Atlanta's 116-101 win Tuesday against New Jersey.

Impact: It is uncertain when the second-round pick of the Hawks this season will make his NBA debut. Don't expect him to be a fantasy contributor.
News: Sy is off the injured list but still isn't active for the Hawks.

Impact: He finishes his preseason 12-of-31 from the floor. Not dreadful, but still far worse than potential fantasy owners would like to see. Coming off of an ankle injury, he's not worth a late-round flier.
News: Jeff Teague went 4-of-14 from the field on Friday night, including 0-of-5 from downtown, helping the Hawks to a 99-66 loss to the Bobcats. He turned the ball over six times in 33:32 of action.

Impact: The Hawks brought both Marvin Williams (knee) and Maurice Evans (knee) back tonight, and they don't need Thomas.  He's played only five minutes all season.
News: Etan Thomas will not be active for Friday's game against the Jazz, according to Brian Smith of the Salt Lake Tribune.

Impact: Wilkins might be in the rotation, but it's unlikely that he stumbles into any sort of fantasy value -- that is, unless "Being the Nephew of an NBA Legend" is a category in your league.
News: Wilkins made his debut for the Hawks on Saturday, scoring zero points in 13 minutes at Miami.

Impact: Williams' knee looked fine, but he failed to score in double figures for the third straight game. Perhaps the Hawks' decision to use him as a shooting guard with Joe Johnson out is to blame. However, even at his more natural position he was a model of inconsistency, and he's still only worth owning in larger leagues until he's able to demonstrate any semblance of reliability.
News: Williams (knee) had seven points, four rebounds and two assists in Tuesday's win over the Nets.

Impact: We expect the point guard to be just fine to place in your lineups this week. He's been somewhat inconsistent, but his overall averages are certainly fantasy worthy. We expect his three-point shooting to improve and would love to see more than 0.7 steals per game.
News: The Bobcats tweet that  D.J. Augustin missed Monday's practice due to the flu. He played through the ailment on Saturday and the team doesn't play again until Wednesday.

Impact: The Bobcats will hold Brown out of the second game of back-to-backs as he continues to ease his way back into action after his ankle injury. He still has a ways to go before becoming a fantasy consideration.
News: Brown will not play Saturday against Phoenix, Bobcats.com reports.

Impact: Carroll, who played in Charlotte from 2004-2009, averaged 1.8 points with the Mavericks last season.
News: After Charlotte's potential deal with Toronto fell through, the Bobcats sent Tyson Chandler and fellow center Alexis Ajinca to the Dallas Mavericks on Tuesday for center Erick Dampier, forward Eduardo Najera, Carroll and cash considerations.

Impact: At the beginning of the season, there was some legitimate concern that Diaw would be ceding time to Tyrus Thomas; however, he's actually averaging slightly more minutes and shots this season than last. Consider him a top-75 player by standard formats.
News: Diaw registered team-highs in minutes (40), points (19), assists (six), and threes (two) Saturday at Philadelphia.

Impact: Diop is not a factor in fantasy leagues when healthy. He is recovering from a sprained MCL in his right knee.
News: DeSagana Diop is inactive for tonight's game versus Atlanta, according to Mike Cranston's (Associated Press) twitter page.

Impact: Even when Henderson is back to full speed, his minutes will likely hover around the 15-minute mark, making him a non-factor as far as fantasy options go.
News: Henderon (knee) hopes to return to practice within a week or so, the Charlotte Observer reports.

Impact: It wasn't the most efficient shooting performance we've ever seen, but Jackson was the Bobcats' best offensive weapon, and his nine fourth-quarter points proved to be crucial in a 100-98 victory. The best part was that his sore left calf, which kept him out of Tuesday morning's shootaround, didn't seem to give him any trouble.
News: Jackson (calf) had a team-high 23 points on 8-of-22 shooting, including 5-of-11 from three-point range, in Tuesday's win over the Nuggets. He added nine rebounds, seven assists, two steals and a block.

Impact: Livingston has been coming off the bench to be an effective scorer for the Bobcats lately. He has scored in double-figures in four of the last six games. Livingston got plenty of playing time on Saturday after Stephen Jackson, was ejected just five minutes into the game.
News: Livingston played close to 28 minutes off the bench against the Bucks and scored a season-high 16 points (5-of-6 FG, 5-of-5 FT). He also put up two assists and two steals in the loss.

Impact: McGuire actually had a pretty big night after Jackson got tossed in Charlotte's last game. With Jackson returning for the next contest, McGuire will go back to a reserve role.
News: McGuire started Wednesday in place of the suspended Stephen Jackson, but had little more than eight rebounds to show for it in Charlotte's loss to New Orleans.

Impact: For all of you fantasy owners that have picked up or held onto Mohammed since his 22-point, 20-rebound explosion on November 13 in hopes that he would do it again, this is likely the closest you will see. He has the ability to have decent nights, but will not see the opportunities or playing time to put up huge statistical nights routinely. A double-double every two or three weeks should be the best you can expect if you're a Mohammed owner.
News: Mohammed recorded a nice 14-point, 11-rebound double-double in just 28 minutes of Friday's overtime win over the Nets. He added two blocks in the win.

Impact: Najera averaged 3.4 points last season in time split between New Jersey and Dallas.
News: After Charlotte's potential deal with Toronto fell through, the Bobcats sent Tyson Chandler and fellow center Alexis Ajinca to the Dallas Mavericks on Tuesday for center Erick Dampier, Najera, shooting guard Matt Carroll and cash considerations.

Impact: Thomas was having a strong game before the injury, racking up 16 points (6-8 FG, 4-4 FT) and four rebounds in just 15 minutes. Fortunately for him, Charlotte has the next two days off, so he'll have some extra time to rest before attempting to return Friday at Indiana.
News: Thomas left Tuesday's game against the Nuggets with left quad tightness and did not return, the Bobcats' official site reports.

Impact: Wallace managed just eight points in his last game as he battled an elbow injury, but he appeared to be healthier Tuesday night and should be safe to use going forward.
News: Wallace played 41 minutes in Tuesday's win over the Nuggets, registering 20 points, nine rebounds, five assists and two steals.

Impact: With the Heat underperforming expectations, this appears to be a case of coach Erik Spoelstra looking for solutions.
News: Anthony was replaced by Zydrunas Ilgauskas in the starting lineup against Toronto on Saturday.

Impact: Arroyo answered with a jumper practically every time the Bucks started to make a run. However, he's still averaging just 7.1 points this season and there's no need to rush out and add him unless he strings together a few good games in a row.
News: Arroyo was a perfect 6-for-6 from the field (2-for-2 from three-point range) and 4-for-4 from the free-throw line on his way to 18 points in Monday's win over the Bucks.

Impact: This was just his fifth double-double of the season, but he does seem to be finding his niche in the Heat's star-laden lineup. The time to buy low on Bosh is likely near past.
News: Chris Bosh posted a double-double on Saturday, with 27 points and 10 rebounds.

Impact: Chalmers is due to make just over $850,000 in his third season. The Heat had until next week to decide on the deal. He has started 104 games in two seasons with the Heat, averaging 8.6 points and 4.2 assists.
News: The Miami Heat have exercised the team option for the final year of Chalmers' contract on Friday, making him only the third player the club has locked in for the coming season.

Impact: Dampier had played no more than 12 minutes in any of his first five games with Miami. If he starts to play 24 minutes regularly he could carve out some value in deep leagues, but this may have just been a one-game aberration.
News: Dampier played 24 minutes off the bench in Monday's win over the Bucks, registering two points, five rebounds and a block.

Impact: Haslem ruptured the Lisfranc ligament in his left foot, which could lead to a recovery time of more than four months. The Heat are saying "out indefinitely" for now, but it's looking increasingly unlikely that Haslem will be much of a fantasy contributor the rest of this season. Miami signed Erick Dampier on Tuesday to help fill the void.
News: Haslem (foot) underwent surgery Tuesday and may miss the remainder of the regular season, the Associated Press reports.

Impact: House seemed to benefit with Dwyane Wade out of action, and could be worth a look in deeper leagues if Wade is forced to miss any time.
News: House connected on 6-of-9 from three-point range and scored 20 points in Saturday night's 97-95 loss to Memphis.

Impact: Howard may see more minutes with Udonis Haslem out, but even if he starts playing 15-20 minutes per game, he's not going to be productive enough to matter in most leagues.
News: Howard had no points and four rebounds in 16 minutes off the bench Monday.

Impact: Ilgauskas added some production elsewhere (two rebounds, one assist, one steal and one block), but his biggest moment in this game came during pregame introductions, when he enjoyed rousing applause amidst the deep boos LeBron James and the rest of the Heat received. In very deep leagues, Igauskas can be worth owning, but his six points and five rebounds per game aren't going to improve anytime soon as long as he's only playing between 15-20 minutes a night.
News: Ilgauskas was held scoreless in 17 minutes against the Cavaliers on Thursday.

Impact: This was James' best game of the season thus far and was a resounding statement in the face of the firestorm surrounding his return to Cleveland.  In fact, there is a possibility that such a huge game under such emotional conditions could help spark James and the Heat out of their slow start to the season.
News: James scored a season-high 38 points on a season-best tying 60 percent shooting from the field (15-for-25 FG) in only 30 minutes of action in a blowout win over the Cavs on Thursday night.  He also added eight assists, five boards, two 3-pointers, a block and a steal in his time on the court.

Impact: Jones has now made at least one three-pointer in five straight games, a stretch in which he has made 15 treys.  The Heat desperately need a consistent long-range shooter to play off of their main players, and if Jones can find the consistency he could hit enough treys to be worth a roster spot.
News: Jones knocked down five 3-pointers on his way to 18 points (6-for-8 FG, 1-for-2 FT) and six boards in 26 minutes Thursday night against the Cavaliers.

Impact: This is the most optimistic timetable we've seen for Miller, who the Heat staff have been targeting for a January return. James obviously isn't a part of the team's medical staff, so this news needs to be taken with a grain of salt, but it's still promising to have Miller's teammates think he's close to a return. If Miller is available on your waiver wire, he's worth grabbing and stashing in most formats.
News: Heat forward LeBron James said on Saturday that Miller (thumb) was "a week or two away" from returning, ESPN's Mike Wallace reports.

Impact: The 6-foot-10, 290-pound center has been with Miami's summer league team after the Heat took him with the 32nd selection in last month's draft. In four seasons at Texas, Pittman averaged 6.6 points and 4.0 rebounds on 62 percent shooting. Miami is also on the cusp of signing two other centers, Zydrunas Ilgauskas from Cleveland and Joel Anthony, who has spent his three NBA seasons with the Heat.
News: The Miami Heat signed Pittman, their second-round pick, on Friday.

Impact: Wade went 9-of-20 from the floor and 7-of-10 from the charity stripe in 39 minutes of action. The 14 boards were a season high.
News: Wade came through with 25 points, 14 rebounds, five assists and a block in the Heat's win Monday.

Impact: Anderson suffered a mid-foot sprain in Friday's drubbing of the woeful Pistons. He was unlikely to play Monday due to his foot injury, but the illness he contracted has put a double whammy down on any possibility that he'd be able to play. Until the team is able to get MRIs taken of his foot, the severity of the injury will remain unknown.
News: Anderson has contracted the illness that has made its rounds in the Magic's locker room, and the team had to put off taking additional MRIs on his sprained right foot as a result, the Magic's official site reports.

Impact: Bass' up-and-down role with the Magic has been a point of contention for fantasy players for nights precisely like this one. He can put up great stats when he plays enough minutes, but the Magic like to surround Howard with shooters to spread the floor. Bass will only be a must-play when Howard is out the game, like he was tonight.
News: Bass capitalized on the absence of an ill Dwight Howard and put up a team-high 27 points (11-12 FG, 5-7 FT) with three rebounds, two assists, and a block off the bench Friday.

Impact: Dwight Howard, J.J. Redick, Jameer Nelson, and Mickael Pietrus all missed the game with one illness or another, and Ryan Anderson left the game with a foot injury. Carter is averaging just 29 minutes per game this season, limiting his potential to put up consistently-dominant statistics.
News: Carter stepped up in the absence of his ill teammates and put up 25 points (10-15 FG, 2-5 3Pt, 3-4 FT), four rebounds, nine assists, and three steals in 41 minutes Friday.

Impact: Duhon was very Duhonsian Friday. Despite playing big minutes, he was unable to produce much in the way of positive statistics. If Jay-Z were asked to describe Duhon's game in one word, he would respond, "Yawn." Nelson could return as early as Saturday.
News: Duhon started at point guard in place of the ill Jameer Nelson on Friday and put up six points, two rebounds, and three assists in 33 minutes.

Impact: Gortat should get a second start Saturday with Howard expected to miss a second straight game with an illness. Feel free to grab Gortat for a spot start, but don't forget that his value will dry up when Howard returns.
News: Gortat started at center in place of an ill Dwight Howard on Friday and put up 14 points (7-9 FG), 11 rebounds, two assists, a steal, and three blocks in 32 minutes.

Impact: Howard had missed the previous two games due to a stomach virus that is sweeping through the league, but if he was still under the weather Monday, it certainly didn't affect his performance. He should be safe to use going forward.
News: Howard (stomach virus) had 14 points, 13 rebounds, three blocks, two steals and an assist in Monday's loss to the Hawks.

Impact: With four key players out due to illness, Lewis played 36 minutes and hoisted 14 shots. Orlando is in a similar situation for Saturday's game against the Bucks and will need Lewis to again shoulder a big offensive load.
News: Lewis (knee) had 15 points, four rebounds and two assists in Friday's win over the Pistons.

Impact: Orlando's next game is Thursday at Portland, and it sounds like Nelson will be available for that contest. The stomach virus that felled five different Orlando players is still sweeping through the NBA, but it seems like the Magic are over it for the most part.
News: Nelson (illness) has been cleared to play during the Magic's upcoming four-game road trip, Dan Savage of the Magic's official site reports.

Impact: Orton wrote on Twitter: Terrible day in summer league today. Gonna get myself together and come back with a focus tomorrow. Gotta slow down, gotta gather myself....
News: Orton had a rough debut in the summer league, getting ejected in an 86-77 loss to Indiana on Monday. He made 1 of 8 shots and 1 of four free throws for three points, three rebounds, five fouls and four turnovers.

Impact: We're willing to give him a free pass on this one since his conditioning is probably still a bit off after missing some time with a nasty illness. He should be healthier for Thursday's game at Portland.
News: Pietrus returned from a stomach virus Monday against the Hawks but was held scoreless in 14 minutes.

Impact: Redick may still be getting back to 100 percent after missing a few days with a nasty stomach virus, but he played fairly well Monday and remains a fantasy option for owners in deep leagues who are looking for three-point shooting help.
News: Redick had 11 points, including a three-pointer, to go along with three rebounds and two assists in Monday's loss to the Hawks.

Impact: Richardson's performance Saturday was his best of the season, and followed a 14-point effort in a win over Cleveland on Friday. He's still not a consistent fantasy performance, averaging 7.6 points on 39.0 percent shooting.
News: Richardson scored a season-high 20 points and grabbed six rebounds in the Magic's 100-99 win at Washington on Saturday.

Impact: Williams entered late in the game and almost immediately got ejected for throwing the ball at Miami's Jamal Magaloire. He's nothing more than a fantasy afterthought at this point.
News: Williams (foot) played one minute in Wednesday's win over Miami.

Impact: Arenas' new role is off the bench, but he's still playing 30-plus minutes as a reserve, so the lack of a spot in the starting five isn't as big of a hindrance as you might think.
News: Arenas recorded 14 points (6-13 FG, 2-6 3pt) and six assists in 32 minutes off the bench in Sunday's loss at Phoenix.

Impact: Armstrong played 12 minutes Friday, which is right in line with his season average. It's hard to produce any kind of fantasy-worthy stats in so little time on the court.
News: Armstrong returned from his one-game suspension Friday against Portland. He posted six points, three rebounds, a steal and a block.

Impact: Scoring was just about the only thing that Blatche provided to his fantasy owners.  Only three rebounds was disappointing, but he should maintain his average of 8.1 rebounds per game this year as he's playing a career-high 34.8 minutes per game.
News: Blatche had 24 points (10-13 FG), but grabbed just three rebounds in 34 minutes in Sunday's loss at Phoenix.

Impact: A polished, if undersized power forward, he'll be a part of the rebuilding effort in Washington.
News: As expected, the Timberwolves have traded the 23rd pick from Thursday evening's draft, forward  Trevor Booker,  to the Washington Wizards, according to ESPN.

Impact: Howard presumably won't be all that sharp whenever he does return, but he could be valuable in deeper formats when or if he does shake off the rust.
News: Howard (knee) might be ready to play as early as Dec. 20, WashingtonWizards.com reports.

Impact: Yi only took a single shot attempt, failing to score, but collected three rebounds and two blocks in his limited minutes. He was averaging 22 minutes per game before he sustained a knee injury, but the emergence of JaVale McGee during Yi's absence may see him playing a reduced role going forward.
News: Yi returned to the Wizards' lineup in Friday's win over the Trailblazers and played 11 minutes off the bench.

Impact: The double-double was his seventh in nine games. After getting off to a slow start this season, he's finally showing the game that had so many excited last summer.
News: JaVale McGee's posted 13 points and 10 rebounds on Friday night, helping the Wizards to an ugly 83-79 win over the Blazers.

Impact: Lee jokes that Seraphin's &quot;vicious screens&quot; in Friday's practice earned him the nod.  Hamady Ndiaye had a shot at being activated against the Hawks, as well, but Seraphin won out.
News: According to Michael Lee of the Washington Post,  Kevin  Seraphin has been activated by the Wizards.

Impact: Thornton has only played 25 total minutes through his first two games back in the Wizards' lineup. He'd been averaging 29 minutes per game prior to the injury. It's tough to know what the Wizards' plans are going forward, but a healthy Yi Jianlian and John Wall could be contributing to Thornton's reduced minutes.
News: Thornton played just 10 minutes off the bench in his second game back from an ankle injury that kept him out for three games.

Impact: He went just 4-of-12 from the field. Watching Nash go for 20 points and 17 assists, he surely picked up a few pointers.
News: Going up against Phoenix's Steve Nash on Sunday evening,  John Wall doled out 12 assists to go along with his 12 points, but couldn't stop the Wizards from losing 125-108 on the road.

Impact: Young is averaging 15.8 points per game over his last five contests, but this is the only category he usually contributes in statistically.  Don't expect big numbers elsewhere.
News: Young (thigh) scored 20 points (8-14 FG, 2-5 3pt) and grabbed four rebounds in 23 minutes off the bench in Sunday's loss at Phoenix.

Impact: Asik got the nod in front of a sellout crowd of 21,125 at the United Center.
News: Asik, the Bulls rookie seven-footer from Turkey, got his first start of the preseason Friday against Dallas.

Impact: Bogans went scoreless in 13 minutes Friday, and he's averaging just 2.4 points, 1.2 rebounds, and 1.0 assists in 15 minutes of action over his last five games. Ronnie Brewer has been stealing most of the minutes at shooting guard lately, but he's been a dud offensively as well.
News: Bogans continues to start at shooting guard for the Bulls, but his role has steadily been diminishing.

Impact: Bozzer's performance Monday was his best for Chicago, as he made 13 of 21 shots while adding 12 rebounds. He should continue performing at a high level for the Bulls, while adding another offensive threat to star point guard Derrick Rose.
News: Boozer scored 29 points in the Bulls' 99-90 win over Oklahoma City on Monday.

Impact: Brewer has been getting averaging more than 26 minutes over his last seven games, so there might be some value here in very deep leagues, but we're not expecting him to produce a rebounding total like this consistently.
News: Brewer had eight points, 10 rebounds, three assists and a steal in Saturday's win over the Kings.

Impact: Deng averaged 34 minutes in 2008-09, 37.9 last year and is up to 39.7 this year. With Boozer sliding back into his power forward spot, Taj Gibson will move to the bench, where he will back up both forward spots, helping to reduce Deng's minutes. The reduction shouldn't have that much of an adverse effect on Deng's production and could make him fresher later in the season.
News: Carlos Boozer's seemingly imminent return may reduce Deng's minutes, Chicago Breaking Sports reports.

Impact: It was a blowout in Orlando's favor, so the numbers are necessarily a little skewed, but something in the vicinity of 20 minutes per game sounds about right for Gibson going forward. He's probably not playable right now by most formats.
News: Gibson (foot) played 23 minutes Wednesday versus Orlando in Carlos Boozer's (hand) return to action.

Impact: Korver scored in double-digits for the fourth time in his last five games. He'll have big nights like Wednesday from time to time, but he'll also put up stinkers like Tuesday's two-point performance against the Lakers. Korver can help teams in need of three-pointers in deep leagues, but he doesn't provide enough consistent value to be roster worthy in standard leagues.
News: Korver played 47 minutes in the Bulls double-overtime win over the Suns on Wednesday and put up 24 points (8-14 FG, 3-7 3PT, 5-6 FT), five rebounds, three assists, a steal, and a block.

Impact: He'll be invited to camp, where he'll have a chance to win the No. 3 point guard job behind Derrick Rose and C.J. Watson.
News: The Bulls have signed  John Lucas to a partially-guaranteed contract, according to ESPN.com.

Impact: After his anomaly of a zero-rebound game against Orlando on Dec. 1, Noah has grabbed double-digit boards the past three games. His daily total may take a hit now that Carlos Boozer is back and close to 100 percent, but he still should be a solid source of boards and blocks.
News: Noah was limited to 20 minutes due to foul trouble but contributed 12 rebounds, six assists and six points in the Bulls' 99-90 win over the Thunder on Monday.

Impact: Notably, Saturday's performance from downtown now brings Rose's season three-point shooting average to above 33%. The addition of that skill, combined with improvement elsewhere, has made him a borderline first-round pick.
News: Rose did everything possible on the basketball court in the Bulls' Saturday overtime win versus Houston, scoring 30 points (13-28 FG, 4-6 3Pt) while also adding seven rebounds, 11 assists, five steals, and a block.

Impact: He's a &quot;good bet&quot; to make the roster, according to Wojnarowski, and he'll bring a lot of energy off the bench if that's the case.  Still, you don't get points for energy in fantasy sports.
News: According to Yahoo's Adrian Wojnarowski,  Brian Scalabrine has agreed to a non-guaranteed deal with the Bulls.

Impact: Thomas is a fine backup big man with great leadership qualities. He'll fill the role of the departed Brad Miller and serve as Joakim Noah's backup at center.
News: The Bulls have signed  Kurt Thomas to a two-year deal, according to Chicago Sun-Times.

Impact: Watson didn't disappoint in his first start of the season, and could be worth a look in deeper leagues if Rose is forced to miss further time.
News: With Derrick Rose on the sidelines, Watson scored a season-high 33 points in Friday night's 98-97 loss to Denver.

Impact: Since being drafted 30th overall in the 2009 draft, Eyenga has yet to play in an NBA game.
News: Eyenga was assigned to Erie of the D-League on Thursday, the Ledger reports.

Impact: Gibson was the only Cavaliers player that seemed up to the challenge of playing well with LeBron James in the house, and he has registered 37 points with five treys in his last two games.
News: Gibson knocked down four 3-pointers on his way to 21 points (6-for-14 FG, 5-for-7 FT) in 28 minutes on Thursday against the Heat.  He also added four boards, two assists and a steal.

Impact: Graham was in the starting lineup at small forward and had eight points, three rebounds, one assist and one blocked shot in 18 minutes in Cleveland's loss to Detroit.
News: Graham returned to the Cavaliers' lineup Sunday after missing one game because of the flu.

Impact: Nights like this make you remember the offensive potential Hickson possesses, but we're still not willing to trust him considering he scored in double figures just once in his previous 10 games. Wait for him to string a couple of these together before entrusting him with a lineup spot again.
News: Hickson had 18 points, four rebounds, a block and a steal in Tuesday's loss to the 76ers.

Impact: A disappointing 25-year-old big man, Hollins averaged 6.1 points and 2.8 rebounds per game a season ago with Minnesota. However, considering both numbers were career highs, he's unlikely to have any fantasy value in 2010-11.
News: Ryan Hollins has been traded to the Cleveland Cavaliers, according to Yahoo! Sports.

Impact: Jamison hasn't lived up to his draft position this season, but he continues to play high minutes and produce off the bench on a team full of under performers receiving light minutes.
News: Jamison played a team-high 30 minutes and scored a team-high 22 points (9-20 FG, 2-7 3PT, 2-2 FT) in Friday's loss to the Magic.

Impact: After watching his team go through a run of particularly bad basketball, head coach Byron Scott told the Cleveland Plain Dealer that he's considering changes to the rotation. It looks like cutting Moon's minutes is just one of the alterations.
News: Moon was a DNP in Sunday's loss to the Pistons.

Impact: Although Parker is a prolific shooter, don't look for big contributions in other statistical categories from him.  Use him sparingly in fantasy basketball leagues.
News: Parker notched 14 points (5-10 FG, 2-4 3pt) in 30 minutes of playing time in Wednesday's win against Milwaukee.

Impact: He hasn't had any serious run since joining Cleveland and returning from a knee injury. With Varejao likely to return soon, Powe will probably have a hard time of breaking back into the rotation.
News: With Anderson Varejao (ribs) absent from the lineup Saturday versus Indiana, Powe played a season-high 21 minutes. He scored nine points (4-6 FG, 1-1 FT) and grabbed three rebounds.

Impact: The 6-foot-9, 260-pounder averaged 15.3 points and 7.0 rebounds last season for the Cardinals before declaring for the NBA. In 70 starts at the school, Samuels averaged 13.6 points and 5.9 rebounds and made 55 percent of his shots. Samuels, 21, played on Chicago's summer league team in Las Vegas. He averaged 12.6 points and 7.4 boards in five games.
News: The Cleveland Cavaliers have signed Samuels, who left Louisville after his sophomore season.

Impact: Sessions is playing between 15-20 minutes per game, and the sparse court time makes it difficult for him to provide any type of consistent production. Witness his last five point totals: 15, 3, 13, 5 and 14. That kind of fluctuation makes him tough to rely on in most standard leagues.
News: Sessions had 14 points on 6-of-10 shooting in Tuesday's loss to the Celtics. He added four assists and three rebounds.

Impact: Varejao had scored eight or fewer points in five straight games coming in, but he played very strong tonight, shooting 7-of-12 from the field.  The double-double was his third this season, all of which have come in November.
News: Anderson Varejao scored 16 points and grabbed 12 rebounds in Cleveland's 106-87 loss to the Celtics.

Impact: Williams had three points on 1-of-6 shooting with two rebounds, two assists and three steals in 23 minutes in Cleveland's loss to Detroit. He's been getting very little of run of late, but with the Cavaliers playing awful basketball, coach Byron Scott trotted him out there.
News: Williams, who started Saturday night in place of the flu-stricken Joey Graham, was back on the bench for Sunday's loss to Detroit.

Impact: The Cavs held tough early, but eventually got steamrolled by LeBron James and the Heat in James' return to Cleveland. The fact that Williams' 11 points were second on the team indicates just how much the Cavs' offense struggled.
News: Williams had 11 points on just 2-of-8 shooting in Thursday's loss to Miami. He added six assists and a rebound.

Impact: The Pistons' lone true point guard, Bynum injured his right hamstring during the preseason and aggravated it in the season-opening loss to New Jersey.
News: Bynum is dealing with an ailing hamstring.

Impact: Daye has now played just 10 minutes total in the past four games. Pistons coach John Kuester plans to stick with his current starting five for at least the next few games, so don't expect Daye to see a jump in minutes any time soon. The sophomore forward can be dumped in most formats.
News: Daye played under four minutes in Friday's win over the Bucks.

Impact: Kuester used a five-man unit consisting of Gordon, Rodney Stuckey, Richard Hamilton, Tayshaun Prince and Ben Wallace to open the second half against the Cavs on Sunday. The lineup juggling helped spur the Pistons to victory and should result in expanded use of that combination. Gordon has now played 30-plus minutes in back-to-back games. If that trend continues, expect added production to soon follow.
News: Pistons coach John Kuester said he would like to use the three-guard lineup he deployed Sunday "a lot" going forward, the Detroit News reports.

Impact: Hamilton's shot was falling on Sunday and he was rewarded with over 35 minutes of playing time, just the third time this season he has eclipsed that mark. While not as prolific of a scorer as in years past, Hamilton is providing an added value this season with his new found range. The 31-year-old guard is averaging a career-high 1.2 threes per contest. As long as he keeps on hitting shots from beyond the arc, Rip will hold value in most formats.
News: Hamilton scored a team-high 27 points (10-of-17 FG, 4-of-6 3Pt, 3-of-3 FT) in Sunday's 102-92 win over Cleveland.

Impact: He tore his Achilles October 6, but he shed his walking boot today and could be nearing a return.  He'd worn the boot for two months after initially hearing he might not play again until March.  There's still no official timetable, but it sounds like the All-Star break could be a new goal.
News: According to NBA.com,  Jonas Jerebko (Achilles) could be ahead of schedule in his recovery.

Impact: It appears Maxiell's job is safe for now, but his hold on the starting power forward role is tenuous at best.
News: Updating an earlier report, coach John Kuester has said that his starting lineup will not change ahead of Friday's game with the Magic,  Keith Langlois of NBA.com reports.

Impact: Kuester has used McGrady as the backup floor general in each of the past two games, but the veteran has averaged just 17 minutes in those two outings. While this move has done little to benefit McGrady's production, it squashes any value Will Bynum had as the team's backup point guard.
News: Pistons coach John Kuester plans to deploy McGrady as the backup point guard for the time being, the Detroit Free Press reports.

Impact: Detroit shot just 37% from the field and Monroe and Charlie Villanueva were the only Pistons to score in double figures. If you didn't already assume so, Detroit got crushed by Miami, 97-72.
News: Greg Monroe was the lone bright spot for the Pistons on Wednesday. He led the team in both points (15) and rebounds (8), which exceeded and tied his season-highs.

Impact: Prince is averaging 19.8 points, 4.8 rebounds, four assists, and 0.8 steals over his last five games. Only Prince and Rodney Stuckey are playing regular rotation minutes for the Pistons right now, and Prince has been making the best of his minutes lately. Make sure he isn't available in your league.
News: Prince put up 30 points (11-15 FG, 2-3 3Pt, 6-7 FT), three rebounds, and five assists in 40 minutes Friday.

Impact: With Will Bynum (two straight DNPs) falling out of favor with coach Jon Keuster, Stuckey is getting all the run he wants at point guard, having played a combined 76 minutes in the past two games.
News: Stuckey scored 24 points and dished 11 assists in 41 minutes in Sunday's win over Cleveland.

Impact: Villanueva doesn't have a set return date, but there's a good chance he'll play Wednesday. He's expected to be back for Friday's game against Minnesota at the latest.
News: Villanueva (personal) will not play against Houston on Tuesday, MLive.com reports.

Impact: Wallace told The Associated Press on Sunday he heard from a lot of teams, but agreed to a two-year deal about a week ago because he wants to retire with the Pistons. He'll make $1.9 million each season.
News: Wallace says he'll sign a two-year contract soon with the Detroit Pistons.

Impact: It is uncertain when the second-round pick this year will make his NBA debut.
News: White is day-to-day with a foot injury.

Impact: Wilcox's injured hamstring has limited him to just one appearance this season. He's near the end of the Pistons rotation, so don't expect big minutes if Wilcox is able to suit up for Sunday's game.
News: Wilcox (hamstring) practiced Friday and could play Sunday against Washington, the Detroit News reports.

Impact: Collison was having a strong game before the injury, scoring 17 points on 6-of-7 shooting to go along with three rebounds, an assist and a steal. No word yet on the nature or severity of the injury, but T.J. Ford could be poised to make a start or two if Collison misses some time.
News: Collison left Monday's game against the Raptors in the fourth quarter with an apparent leg injury, the Indianapolis Star's Mike Wells reports.

Impact: When Rush starts, Dunleavy's minutes are typically limited (21.8 mpg in four games as reserve), but that wasn't the case against the smallish Suns' lineup Friday. This makes the third time in the last four games that Dunleavy was brought off the bench. O'Brien insists both players can start or come off the bench, depending on the matchup that particular night. For fantasy players in daily leagues, look at the Pacers' opponent. If there's a scorer at shooting guard -- say, Kobe Bryant, Dwyane Wade or Jason Richardson -- O'Brien will want Rush's defense in the starting lineup. Otherwise, you can expect Dunleavy to start (32.5 mpg as a starter).
News: Dunleavy scored 16 points (6-of-11 FG, 2-of-5 3pt, 2-of-2 FT) with eight rebounds and two blocks in 30 minutes off the bench in Indiana's loss to Phoenix on Friday. Brandon Rush got the start at shooting guard with coach Jim O'Brien wanting a better defender against the Suns' Jason Richardson.

Impact: Ford got some extra playing time because Darren Collison was struggling with turnovers, but we imagine that Collison will regain the upper hand in the playing time battle soon.
News: Ford had 10 points and nine assists in 26 minutes off the bench Friday against Phoenix.

Impact: Foster, who opened the season behind Jones and then had an ankle injury, was getting some run in mid-November before his back flared up. Jones used that opportunity to become more active on the boards and that's been working for coach Jim O'Brien. "I have a great deal of confidence with Jeff," O'Brien said. "I think Jeff's a hell of a player. We have Roy [Hibbert], who is getting 30 minutes a game. That leaves you with 18 minutes. You can't go nine (minutes) and nine (minutes). If we're only playing Roy 20 minutes a game, we can play everybody."
News: Foster has slipped behind Solomon Jones on the Pacers' depth chart at center, the Indianapolis Star reports.

Impact: This seemed a likely possibility given Brandon Rush's return from suspension. Unless there are significant injuries on the Pacers, George will have no fantasy value as a rookie.
News: Rookie  Paul George  has been bumped from the Pacers rotation, according to Mike Wells.

Impact: Granger was coming off a couple of bad games at the end of the Pacers' road trip last week, but was able to find his stroke against the defensively challenged Raptors. The Pacers ran out to a big lead early, allowing Granger to get more rest than usual.
News: Granger scored 21 points on 9-of-16 shooting from the field, including 2-of-5 from 3-point range, in Indiana's win over Toronto on Monday. He also had nine rebounds, five assists, one steal and one blocked shot in 31 minutes.

Impact: Hansbrough can certainly bring some energy to the floor, but he's still learning how to play away from the basket, something coach Jim O'Brien wants in his power forwards. That's why we're seeing much of the minutes at the four going to Josh McRoberts and James Posey.
News: Hansbrough's only playing time in Monday's blowout win over Toronto came in the final six-and-a-half minutes, the Indianapolis Star reports.

Impact: Hibbert picked up some early fouls and was a non-factor in Indiana's loss to Phoenix on Friday.
News: Hibbert scored 13 points on 6-of-9 shooting with six rebounds, six assists and two blocks in the Pacers' win over the Raptors on Monday.

Impact: Jones got off to a slow start with just four rebounds in his first 70 minutes of play. At 6-10, that wasn't cutting it. O'Brien sat him while giving his minutes to Jeff Foster, but Foster's ankle injury forced the coach to go back to Jones. Given a second chance, Jones responded. He's averaging 5.0 rebounds in 17.1 minutes per game in the last seven games.
News: Jones has moved ahead of Jeff Foster on the Pacers' depth chart at center, the Indianapolis Star reports. "I'm just getting an opportunity and making the best of it," Jones said. "(Coach Jim O'Brien) has gotten confidence in me, and my teammates have been feeling the same. I know what to expect, so I can go out there and play without anything on my shoulders."

Impact: McRoberts had a prolonged stretch of games in which he was giving fantasy owners little in the way of production, but there's been a slight uptick lately. In the last seven games, he's averaging 9.9 points, 6.3 rebounds, 3.7 assists and 2.1 blocks in 25.1 minutes a night. Tyler Hansbrough is barely playing, and the power forward job is primarily McRoberts' these days.
News: McRoberts scored 12 points (4-of-11 FG, 1-of-4 3pt, 3-of-4 FT) with seven rebounds, six assists, three blocks and two steals in 26 minutes Monday night in Indiana's win over Toronto.

Impact: Posey got more run than both Josh McRoberts (24 minutes) and Tyler Hansbrough (DNP), as the Pacers continue to stitch together a power-forward rotation. His playing time tends to vary and is dependent on outside forces, but he can be effective as a three-point scorer. He's made at least one 3-ball in 11 of 13 games played and hitting at a 39-percent success rate in November (22-for-57).
News: Posey scored nine points on 3-of-6 shooting, all three-pointers, with seven rebounds, one assist and one steal in 29 minutes in Indiana's loss to Oklahoma City on Friday.

Impact: With Darren Collison (ankle) out, T.J. Ford started at point guard with Price elevated to backup. Price was probably the Pacers' best player during training camp and preseason games, but has been inactive with Collison and Ford getting all the run at point guard. It would be a different story had Indiana been able to trade Ford or buy out his contract.
News: Price was active for the first time this season and played 11 minutes Tuesday night. He scored seven points (2-of-3 FG, 3-of-3 FT) with two assists and a turnover in Indiana's loss to Atlanta.

Impact: The Raptors weren't doing too much in the way of defending with Rush and his teammates getting any shot they wanted. Rush, who was back in a reserve role after starting against Phoenix on Friday, has led the Pacers in scoring in the last two games.
News: Rush scored a game-high 26 points on 10-of-18 shooting from the field, including 6-of-8 from 3-point range, in 32 minutes off the bench Indiana's win over Toronto on Monday.

Impact: Team president Larry Bird said the team is considering the move following the 2010-11 season.  The rookie dealt with an assault charge back in the summer, and needless to say, his career hasn't started the way he or Indiana would have hoped.
News: Lance Stephenson could be sent down the D League after this season, according to Mike Wells of the Indianapolis Star.

Impact: Bogut went just 4-of-12 from the field, but he only committed one turnover and continues to produce when in the lineup. He's averaging a career-best 11.5 rebounds per game this season.
News: Bogut had 11 points, 13 rebounds, three assists and three blocks during the Bucks' loss to the Heat on Monday.

Impact: Agent Mark Termini said the 11-year veteran had offers from other teams but was comfortable with Milwaukee, one of nine teams the 5-foot-5 Boykins has played for previously. Boykins has averaged 9.3 points and 3.4 assists per game during his NBA career. Boykins will likely back up Brandon Jennings for the Bucks, who lost guard Luke Ridnour as a free agent to Minnesota this summer.
News: Boykins has signed a one-year, $1.3 million contract with the Milwaukee Bucks.

Impact: With Bogut day-to-day, look for Brockman to quickly return to the bench.
News: Brockman started at center in place on Andrew Bogut (back) in Wednesday's loss at Cleveland, but played just 13 minutes, scoring six points and grabbing four rebounds.

Impact: "It's frustrating because it's nothing you can control," Delfino said. "You have to be honest with yourself, continue to work and if you feel bad, just stop. If you try to overdo it will make it worse." Delfino has been lightly riding a stationary bike recently, but that's about the extent of his physical activity. He remains out indefinitely.
News: Delfino said a recent evaluation showed him to be 90 percent free of his concussion-like symptoms, but he has to be symptom-free before he will be cleared to get back on the court, the Milwaukee Journal Sentinel reports.

Impact: Dooling's big night was unexpected, as the guard is playing only 15.2 minutes per game this year.  Don't expect big nights like this from Dooling regularly.  He usually isn't considered a fantasy option.
News: Dooling had 18 points (7-14 FG, 2-5 3pt) and dished out five assists in 25 minutes off the bench in Wednesday's loss at Cleveland.

Impact: CDR has scored 30 points in two games since missing the first 15 games with an eye injury.
News: Douglas-Roberts scored 19 points in a loss to the Jazz on Monday.

Impact: It was the fourth missed game out of the last five contests for Gooden, who remains day-to-day with the injury.
News: Gooden (foot) didn't play Monday.

Impact: Ilyasova didn't disappoint in his first start of the season, and could be worth a look in deeper leagues if his minutes start to increase.
News: Ilyasova matched a season-high with 17 points and grabbed nine rebounds in Saturday night's 104-101 win over Charlotte.

Impact: Jennings has been the Bucks' most consistent offensive option, averaging 18.4 points on the season and 28.0 the last three games.
News: Jennings had 27 points on 8-of-20 shooting in a loss to the Jazz on Monday.

Impact: Maggette returned after missing two games with a sore ankle. He's only averaging 12.8 points per game this season, and because of the Bucks' glut of players on the wing, his playing time isn't likely to trend upward anytime soon unless some injuries strike.
News: Maggette (ankle) had 17 points, four assists and a steal in Wednesday's loss to the Nuggets.

Impact: Mbah a Moute also notched a steal, but don't be fooled by tonight's game.  He has three double-doubles this season, but he averages just 5.5 rebounds and 5.6 points.
News: Luc Mbah a Moute grabbed 10 rebounds and scored 12 points in a 104-101 win over Charlotte.

Impact: Redd made an appearance at Bucks practice Tuesday and looked like he was in great shape. He has been sidelined since undergoing knee surgery last season. There's been previous speculation Redd could miss the entire season, so don't bother stashing him on your bench until he shows some progress and a concrete timetable is set.
News: Redd (knee) is still targeting a February return, Gary Woelfel of Racine Journal Times reports.

Impact: Salmons is struggling to regain his form from last year, but he should get better as he's playing 38.0 minutes per game over the last five contests.
News: Salmons scored 14 points (6-14 FG, 2-3 3pt) in 43 minutes of action in Wednesday's loss at Cleveland.

Impact: Sanders has been hot and cold all season, and tonight was no different.  He hit just 5-of-12 shots, though he did block two, but we have a hard time recommending him no matter what Gooden's status is.
News: Larry Sanders  scored 10 points and added six boards in relief of Drew Gooden in Monday's 88-78 loss to Miami.

Impact: Skinner will add depth to the Bucks' frontcourt, but he shouldn't have much of a role in the rotation.
News: The Bucks signed Skinnner on Thursday, the team's official site reports.

Impact: Allen is averaging 12.4 points and has hit 9 of 22 from 3-point range during the Celtics' five-game winning streak.
News: Allen missed his first five 3-point attempts before hitting one with 10.7 seconds left, and Boston held on to beat the Trail Blazers 99-95 on Wednesday.

Impact: The 19th pick in last summer's draft, he is expected to be used mostly as a defensive specialist this season. That fact, coupled with his lingering injury, makes him undraftable.
News: Avery Bradley (recovery from ankle surgery)  will not be ready for the start of Celtics training camp, according to ESPN's Chris Forsberg.

Impact: Because of the lopsided nature of this game, Daniels played 33 minutes, well above his season average of 17. Don't expect this type of production to become a trend.
News: Daniels poured in 16 points on 7-of-10 shooting in Tuesday's 106-87 win over Cleveland. He added four rebounds, two steals and a block.

Impact: KG is playing like the KG of old lately, averaging more than 17 points and 12 rebounds over his last five games.
News: Garnett had 13 points, 14 rebounds and four assists in the Celtics' win over the Nets on Sunday.

Impact: He added 16 points and two steals. At just 6-foot-8, he's looking like he could be this season's DeJuan Blair.
News: Luke Harangody grabbed 12 rebounds in just 21:32 of playing time in Boston's preseason win over the Knicks on Wednesday.

Impact: O'Neal has been sidelined since early November with knee soreness, and although he's been doing individual workouts, he's still a couple weeks away from returning to the Celtics' lineup.  The Celtics want to make sure they have a healthy lineup down the road, so they are being cautious with guys like O'Neal and Rajon Rondo.  Expect O'Neal to be eased back in the lineup when he's healthy enough to return.
News: O'Neal (knee) hopes to return to practice in two weeks, the Boston Globe reports.

Impact: O'Neal did not play in the second half of Sunday's game against the Nets due to a sore right calf. Hopefully we'll learn more about his status after Tuesday's practice, but it sounds like the Celtics may not know anything about his availability until Wednesday night.
News: O'Neal (calf) could be a game-time decision for Wednesday's game against the Nuggets, CSN's A. Sherrod Blakely reports.

Impact: The Celtics will look to close out the Magic in Game 4 on Monday, and if they do Perkins will have plenty of time to rest his ailing wrist.  He is expected to get his normal amount of minutes in Game 4.
News: Perkins has a sprained right wrist, but he participated in a full shootaround on Monday, cites Josh Robbins of The Orlando Sentinel.

Impact: With Kevin Garnett missing time getting stitches in his chin, Pierce took on the scoring load, matching his season high. Expect the scoring to be more evenly distributed Friday against the Bulls.
News: Pierce had 28 points and seven rebounds in the Celtics' win over the Blazers on Wednesday.

Impact: Robinson is expected to play Wednesday against the Nuggets, but we'll let you know if that assessment changes.
News: Robinson did not practice Tuesday due to a death in the family, CNNNE.com's A. Sherrod Blakely reports.

Impact: Boston employed a similar plan with Kevin Garnett last season. Rondo is questionable for Wednesday's game against Denver, but coach Doc Rivers indicated that the Celtics may give some thought to shutting Rondo down for more than a game or two. "That may come at some point," Rivers said. "It has been suggested already, I can tell you that." This is troubling news for Rondo owners, and we'll be monitoring this situation closely. When Rondo is out, Nate Robinson will continue to replace him in the starting lineup.
News: Rondo (hamstring) did not practice Tuesday, and the Celtics are considering a plan to "strategically rest" him to help keep him healthy, CSNNE.com reports.

Impact: Wafer declined to comment before Friday night's game against the New York Knicks. West was not available for comment. West is inactive for the first 10 games this season after pleading guilty this summer to weapons charges in Maryland. West played for Cleveland last season. He was traded to Minnesota and waived by the Timberwolves before the Celtics signed him. Wafer is with his sixth team in six seasons.
News: Boston Celtics backup guards Delonte West and Von Wafer scuffled after practice on Friday. Coach Doc Rivers confirmed that the two fought. He would not say what the cause was or whether either faced disciplinary action.

Impact: "Even though we're (six) days out of surgery, I'm going to be back a lot quicker than we thought," West said. How much quicker? Although it's still a long shot, there's a chance West could return before the end of December, which would be remarkable considering that the injury was originally feared to be season-ending. A January return seems like a realistic possibility.
News: West said his recovery from a broken right wrist is well ahead of schedule, CNNNE.com reports.

Impact: It looked like Farmar's value might evaporate completely when Devin Harris returned from his knee injury, but Farmar has played 27 minutes and scored 16 points in both games since Harris' return. He's probably worth holding onto in deeper leagues.
News: Farmar had 16 points on 5-of-10 shooting, including three 3-pointers, in Tuesday's loss to the Hawks. He added three assists, two rebounds and a steal.

Impact: Although Favors could indeed one day be elite, it would make little sense to hold onto him when he could net a player of Carmelo Anthony's caliber. Of course, if 'Melo does not first agree to a contract extension, such a trade could end up being a true disaster for the ever-bungling Nets.
News: Despite being &quot;ecstatic&quot; with rookie  Derrick Favors' start this season, the Nets are still itching to trade him for Denver's Carmelo Anthony, according to the Bergen Record.

Impact: Graham's a non-factor fantasy-wise, no matter the format.  He was activated after Terrence Williams (abdominal strain) was ruled out for tonight's game.
News: The Nets activated  Stephen Graham Tuesday, according to Al Iannazzone of the Bergen Record.

Impact: Harris is still working his way back from a knee injury, but he did a terrific job of getting to the stripe Tuesday night. He'll start hitting his shots eventually.
News: Harris was just 2-for-8 from the field, but went 13-for-16 from the free-throw line to finish with 18 points in Tuesday's loss to the Hawks. He added 13 assists and three steals.

Impact: Humphries' scoring numbers have started to trail off recently, but he remains strong on the glass, hauling in an average of 7.8 boards per game. As long as he continues to get minutes, he'll be useful in that category.
News: Humphries had eight points (3-7 FG, 2-2 FT), seven rebounds and five assists in Tuesday's loss to the Hawks.

Impact: A solid shooter and defender, James could contribute right away next season. He likely won't develop into an All-Star, but could be a solid sixth-man type.
News: Drafted with the 24th pick by the Atlanta Hawks in Thursday's NBA Draft, Texas forward  Damion James  has been traded to the New Jersey Nets.

Impact: Offensively, Lopez bounced back quickly from a miserable five-point effort against the Celtics on Sunday, though his rebounding numbers continue to be a disappointment. He might catch a break Thursday if Dallas center Tyson Chandler, who missed Tuesday's game because of a stomach illness, sits out another game.
News: Lopez had 24 points (8-16 FG, 8-11 FT), five rebounds and a steal in Tuesday's loss to the Hawks.

Impact: Morrow is capable of big games, but is averaging 12.9 points this season.
News: Morrow had 25 points in a triple-overtime loss to the Thunder on Wednesday.

Impact: He's healthy as far as we know, so his frosty relationship with coach Avery Johnson seems like the most likely culprit for Tuesday's disappearance. Murphy has strong potential if Johnson ever decides to let him loose, but at this point a trade out of New Jersey would probably be the ideal situation for Murphy owners. He's too risky to rely on in most leagues right now.
News: Murphy did not play in Tuesday's loss to the Hawks.

Impact: Outlaw scored 20 or more points for the first time in 10 games.
News: Outlaw scored 21 points in the New Jersey's 91-84 overtime loss to Charlotte on Friday.

Impact: Petro and his $10 million contract have been riding the bench far more than expected to start the season, and he seems to have fallen behind Kris Humphries for minutes behind Brook Lopez.  Lopez is having some serious shooting issues lately, so maybe that will be enough for coach Avery Johnson to shake the rust off Petro in the upcoming games.
News: Petro was a DNP-CD against the Cavs on Tuesday.

Impact: We don't imagine many fantasy owners will be losing sleep over losing Ross and his 0.9 points per game.
News: Ross suffered a calf strain in the first half of Friday's loss to the Kings and did not return, the Associated Press reports.

Impact: Smith received the veteran minimum of $1,352,131, the team said. The first pick overall in the 1995 draft, Smith is joining his 11th team in a 15-year NBA career. He appeared in 64 games with Atlanta last season, averaging 3.0 points and 2.5 rebounds.
News: The New Jersey Nets signed Smith to a one-year contract on Friday.

Impact: After shredding the D-League apart for three games, Williams got the call back to New Jersey on Tuesday only to find himself on the inactive list. If given the minutes, he can clearly be a fantasy factor, but that's no guarantee right now. If you have the roster room, the best strategy is to stick him on the bench and hope that he eventually sees the light of day.
News: Williams did not play in Tuesday's loss to the Hawks.

Impact: Such a return would be about 7-10 days earlier than previous estimates have indicated.  Azubuike would return to a team that is starting to settle into a rotation and that makes it tough for him to garner immediate fantasy value.  If the Knicks are going well, he could be left on the outside looking in for the time being.
News: The New York Post says that guard,  Kelenna Azubuike (knee) had his first full-day of practice on Tuesday and could be back as soon as next week.

Impact: Chandler remained in the starting lineup despite the return of Ronny Turiaf, and coach Mike D'Antoni said after the game that he will be sticking with the same starting lineup that has produced five straight wins, the Bergen Record reports. Don't let Turiaf's return dissuade you from starting Chandler in nearly all leagues.
News: Chandler had 21 points (7-12 FG, 2-6 3Pt, 5-6 FT), five assists, four rebounds, two steals and a block in Monday's win over the Timberwolves.

Impact: This is yet another encouraging sign for Curry, but the Knicks have still yet to announce when he will return. When he does return, don't expect him to be a valid fantasy option as he will likely play limited minutes.
News: Curry (hamstring) is progressing and participated in full-court 4-on-4 drills Monday, the New York Post reports.

Impact: Douglas finally showed some signs of life after averaging just 3.8 points over his last five games. Perhaps he's getting closer to 100 percent after being bothered by a quad injury last week.
News: Douglas had 11 points and six rebounds in 21 minutes off the bench in Monday's win over the Timberwolves.

Impact: Felton went 6-of-13 from the floor, including 5-of-8 from downtown, also recording four steals in 38 minutes of action. He's in the midst of a career year and shows no signs of slowing down anytime soon.
News: Felton scored 18 points and handed out 11 assists during the Knicks' win Monday.

Impact: The double-double was his third in five games, and sixth of his rookie season. If you haven't yet take a flier on him, now is certainly the time to do so.
News: Landry Fields scored 15 points and grabbed 10 rebounds on Sunday, helping the Knicks to a 116-99 rout of the Raptors.

Impact: He now has just 13 points in his past two games, going 4-of-15 from the field in the process. He's going to have to be better for the Knicks to win, and for his fantasy owners to justify running him out there.
News: Danilo Gallinari scored just four points in New York's 99-90 loss to the Hawks on Saturday.

Impact: Mason averaged 6.3 points and 2.1 rebounds in 19 games with the Spurs last season.
News: Mason signed with the Knicks on Tuesday.

Impact: The Russian's production has been very limited this season, and he won't be missed in fantasy leagues if he can't give it a go on Friday. He is day-to-day.
News: Dealing with a sore calf, big-man  Timofey Mozgov is questionable for Friday night against the Warriors, according to Newsday's Alan Hahn.

Impact: Randolph received a DNP - Coach's Decision on Wednesday and appears headed for another. The talented big man has struggled to find his game in his first season with the Knicks. He'll need to show vast improvements before he becomes a significant part of the rotation and starts making an impact in fantasy.
News: If Timofey Mozgov (sore calf) is able to play, Knicks coach Mike D'Antoni plans to sit Randolph for Friday's game against the Warriors, Marc Berman of the New York Post reports.

Impact: It looks like he will indeed be on the Knicks' opening night roster. He will almost certainly be limited to fewer than 15 minutes per game this season.
News: Knicks head coach Mike D'Antoni is impressed with rookie three-point specialist  Andy Rautins, according to the New York Post. &quot;Andy Rautins looks really good,&quot; D'Antoni said on Friday. &quot;He can make the quick shot.&quot;

Impact: Stoudemire grabbed just five boards but went 4-of-5 from the line and also added two steals and two blocks. He's playing as well as he has at any point during his career, helping New York win five straight.
News: Stoudemire erupted for 34 points on 15-of-23 shooting during the Knicks' win over the Timberwolves on Monday.

Impact: After the game, coach Mike D'Antoni told the Bergen Record that Turiaf will remain in a bench role while the Knicks stick with the starting lineup that has produced five straight wins. Turiaf's value remains limited to a cheap source of blocks and rebounds in deep leagues.
News: Turiaf returned Monday against the Timberwolves after missing the previous four games because of left knee problems. He played 12 minutes, registering four points, three assists and a block.

Impact: Walker is averaging just 13.3 minutes this season and isn't a fantasy consideration in most leagues. Consider him day-to-day until we know more about the severity of this injury.
News: Walker has a knee injury and will not play Monday against the Timberwolves, NBA.com's Adam Zagoria reports.

Impact: Williams has now played 20-plus minutes in three straight games and is averaging 13.3 points, 3.3 three-pointers and 1.0 blocks during that span. We're not sure how long the Knicks plan to keep giving him this type of run, but if you're desperate for some long-range shooting, he has some value right now.
News: Williams had 13 points, including three 3-pointers, in Monday's win over the Timberwolves. He added two rebounds, two blocks and an assist.

Impact: That 4-for-4 included a 1-for-1 from three-point land. That's fine, but it's unlikely that Battie either (a) hits another one this season or (b) becomes rosterable for fantasy purposes.
News: Battie recorded nine points on perfect 4-for-4 shooting -- plus six rebounds -- versus New Jersey on Saturday.

Impact: A first-round pick last summer, Brackins has been active just one time this season. Obviously he needs to be playing more than that if he wants his game to develop. Expect him to rejoin Philadelphia some time after the new year.
News: According to the Delaware Journal's Martin Frank, the Sixers have assigned rookie forward  Craig Brackins  to Springfield of the NBA's Developmental League.

Impact: Brand is averaging 15.0 points and 10.0 boards in his last four road games.
News: Brand scored 16 points with a season-best 14 boards on Friday in a 93-88 loss at Atlanta.

Impact: Hawes has some upside as a scoring big man, but he was simply too inconsistent with the Kings. His place in the rotation was constantly in the air, which proved to be very frustrating for fantasy owners. The trade of Dalembert leaves the 76ers without a true center, so Hawes is in contention for a starting spot for now. However, if the team decides to select Derrick Favors in next week's draft, it would be tough to envision Hawes starting over he or a healthy Elton Brand on a regular basis.
News: Hawes and Andres Nocioni were traded to the 76ers on Thursday in exchange for Samuel Dalembert, ESPN.com reports.

Impact: After Friday's four points and five assists, Holiday bounced back with a solid all-around performance tonight. The 2009 first-round pick hasn't been the fantasy force many predicted this season, but he's a must-start every night.
News: Jrue Holiday had 15 points, seven assists, four rebounds, two steals and two blocks to lead the Sixers over the Bobcats on Saturday.

Impact: Iguodala is barely shooting 40 percent over his last five games, and his shooting woes are part of the reason why his scoring is down a bit this season, but he does enough in the other categories to make up for it. We imagine he'll find his shooting stroke before long.
News: Despite shooting just 3-for-12 from the field, Iguodala finished with 13 points, seven assists, six rebounds, two steals and a block in Tuesday's win over the Cavs.

Impact: Kapono missed the Sixers' last four games due to personal reasons. Though he started the year as the team's starter at small forward, Kapono's role quickly diminished. Even without family issues taking him away from the court, Kapono would be a candidate to be inactive for the Sixers. He won't have much fantasy value unless he starts playing about 25 minutes a night and burying three-pointers at a good clip.
News: Kapono (personal) practiced with the Sixers' on Monday, the Sixers' official site reports.

Impact: That's a lot of career-highs, huh? Meeks displaced Evan Turner in the starting lineup Friday and certainly strengthened his case with the performance. Fantasy owners will note, however, that Meeks contributed precious little in other categories. He's worth a look, certainly, but he's not a fantasy cure-all.
News: Making his second-career start Saturday, Meeks hit a career-high seven three-pointers en route to career-high 26 points versus Charlotte.

Impact: Evan Turner was moved to a bench role, and Jodie Meeks started at shooting guard. As strange as it may seem, Nocioni's benching was likely just an oversight due to match-ups against the Hawks. He should continue to come off the bench and play a decent number of minutes going forward, but if the Sixers continue to look towards evaluating their young talent, there is the possibility that Nocioni could find himself sitting a lot of nights. It's a situation that bears watching in deep leagues.
News: Nocioni was in the running to enter the Sixers' starting lineup for Friday's game against the Hawks, but he ended up receiving a DNP-CD.

Impact: Songaila has averaged 7 points and 3.5 rebounds in seven seasons with Sacramento, Chicago, Washington and the Hornets.
News: The Philadelphia 76ers have acquired rookie forward Craig Brackins and Songaila from the New Orleans Hornets for Willie Green and Jason Smith.

Impact: Speights' minutes were true, and he seems to be  inching closer to solidifying a regular role off the bench. Elton Brand's ejection didn't come until the last few minutes of the game, so Speights' minutes were not improved much by it. Speights could put up some gaudy numbers over the next few games if Brand ends up being suspended by the league for his flagrant-two foul from Tuesday.
News: Speights played a season-high 29 minutes in Tuesday's loss to the Wizards and recorded 16 points (8-13 FG, 0-1 3PT), nine rebounds, and two blocks.

Impact: Turner hasn't played well as of late, with single-digit points in five of his past six games to go with a putrid shooting percentage. A move to the bench won't help his numbers any, and would make the No. 2 pick of June's draft barely worth a roster spot.
News: The Philadelphia Daily News reports that Doug Collins is considering pulling Evan Turner from the 76ers' starting lineup. &quot;I think Evan is trying to find his way with that [starting] group. Definitely, I will consider [removing him as a starter],&quot; said Collins.

Impact: Over his last five games, Williams is averaging just 8.2 points (22 percent), 2.0 rebounds, 3.2 assists, and 1.2 three-pointers in 23 minutes per game. He injured his left (non-shooting) shoulder against the Thunder on Nov. 10 and hasn't shot well since. Thaddeus Young has stepped up in his stead and proven to be terrifically efficient as a scorer off the bench.
News: Williams' shooting struggles continue to limit his value in fantasy.

Impact: Young is averaging 14.8 points and shooting 64.3 percent in his last nine games.
News: Young made 11 of 12 shots and had a season-high 26 points and the Philadelphia 76ers beat the struggling Cavaliers 117-97 on Tuesday night for their fourth win in five games.

Impact: His 31 minutes tied a season-high, and he's now scored double-digit points in six of his past eight games.  If you're looking for points and threes in a deep league, he could be your guy, but his value is limited in standard formats with so many wings available in Toronto.
News: Leandro Barbosa played 31 minutes off the bench Monday night, scoring 12 points in a 124-100 loss to the Pacers.

Impact: He continues to blossom now that he's out of Chris Bosh's shadow, maintaining his scoring average north of 20 points a game and now teasing that he might be developing some consistent rebounding skills as well, with 8.8 RPG over his last four games.
News: Bargnani led the Raptors with 26 points and 12 rebounds in a 111-99 win over the Thunder Friday.

Impact: Bayless played just 18 minutes in the blowout loss and watched Jose Calderon pour in 21 points, so perhaps speculation that he would be moving into a true time-share with Calderon was a bit overblown. He's still worth keeping an eye on in deeper leagues, but temper your expectations.
News: Bayless had five points on 2-of-10 shooting in Monday's loss to the Pacers. He added four rebounds, two assists and a steal.

Impact: Calderon was physically ill before Sunday's game, but he looked much healthier on Monday and was one of few Raptors to be productive in a losing effort. He's averaging more than 10 points and eight assists since taking over as the starter.
News: Calderon had a team-high 21 points on 8-of-12 shooting, including two three-pointers, in Monday's loss to the Pacers. He added four assists and a steal.

Impact: Given the lackluster options at power forward in Toronto, Davis bares close monitoring. He could legitimately earn a starting job ahead of Amir Johnson and Joey Dorsey by Christmas.
News: Ed Davis made his NBA debut in Wednesday night's win over the Wizards and finished with 11 points, six rebounds, and two blocks on 5-of-7 shooting. The rookie played 24 minutes.

Impact: The Toronto Sun reports that DeRozan has been slowed down the last few games by a hamstring pull that he suffered 10 days ago against Boston, but he looked 100% in Wednesday's win.
News: DeRozan scored 20 points with six rebounds and three assists in just 28 minutes of court time Wednesday.

Impact: The Raptors have three viable options at power forward right now between Dorsey, Amir Johnson and first round pick Ed Davis, so it's hard to see any of them getting enough court time to have a big fantasy impact. Dorsey's effort on the boards and on defense should ensure he gets his share of minutes, however.
News: Dorsey played over 18 minutes off the bench Wednesday, scoring five points with eight rebounds (including five offensive boards) and three steals.

INJURY STATUS: 11/28/2010Day to day. (Broken bone in right foot)
Impact: Evans was the Raptors' starting power forward before injuring his foot. The promising rookie debut of Ed Davis, and the play of the Raptors' other bigs could leave Evans destined for a bench role when he returns.
News: Evans underwent surgery on his right foot Wednesday and is expected to be out about eight weeks, the Toronto Sun reports.

Impact: He's settling in nicely as the starting power forward, averaging 17.0 points and 11.3 rebounds while shooting .688 (22-for-32) from the floor over his three-game surge.
News: Johnson had his third straight solid game Monday, scoring 15 points on 7-for-13 shooting with nine rebounds.

Impact: Stojakovic is not traveling with the team on their current road trip, so we assume he'll be out for Wednesday's game at the Knicks as well. Monday's contest will be the fifth straight game Stojakovic has missed.
News: Stojakovic (knee) will not play Monday against the Pacers, Raptors radio announcer Paul Jones reports.

Impact: Weems has now scored 10 points or fewer in six of his last seven games. It's tough to play him in most leagues given the inconsistency, especially while the Raptors tinker with their rotation to try to find some combinations that work.
News: Weems had just eight points on 3-of-10 shooting in Monday's blowout loss to the Pacers.

Impact: Wright put up seven points (3-7 FG, 1-2 3PT, 0-1 FT), four rebounds, two assists, a steal, and two blocks in 24 minutes Friday. After being left on the bench in four of the Raptors' first seven games, he's carved out over 20 minutes of playing time in their last two games. Some of his minutes have been an inheritance from the hobbled Linas Kleiza, but he's produced enough for fantasy players to take notice and put him on their watch lists. Wright has the ability to contribute in steals, blocks, threes, points, and rebounds. However, he's usually struggled when given the opportunity to start. We're not bullish on him, but Wright remains only 23-years-old and could put it all together at some point.
News: Wright has played over 20 minutes in each of the Raptors' last two games.

Impact: The rookie entered with career totals of 12 points and 18 rebounds so he showed some promise and could be a player to watch in the future.
News: Adrien scored 9 points and added 10 rebounds - both career highs - in Sunday night's 117-89 loss to the Lakers.

INJURY STATUS: 10/19/2010Day to day. (Surgery on right index finger)
Impact: He has yet to play this season, so there's bound to be some rust, but he'll have a chance to carve out a major bench role fairly quickly. He's worth monitoring in deeper leagues.
News: Amundson (finger) said he will play Tuesday against Dallas, the San Francisco Chronicle's Rusty Simmons reports.

Impact: It always looks bad when a player doesn't enter a game in which the team has taken a 32-point lead. The Pistons eventually closed the gap and made this one a squeaker, but the point is that Bell is getting very little run (9.4 mpg) for Golden State with four DNPs in 11 games.
News: Bell did not play in Monday night's win over Detroit.

Impact: Biedrins had four points, six rebounds, three assists, one steal and one blocked shot in the loss.
News: Biedrins, who left Golden State's previous game because of a stomach illness, started and played 23 minutes in Sunday's loss to the Thunder.

Impact: Carney says he's been dealing with the pain for a bit, but he was able to play through it until late last week. He has some exams scheduled and fears it might be plantar fasciitis.
News: Carney (foot) suited up Sunday but didn't play in Golden State's loss to Oklahoma City, the Contra Costa Times reports.

Impact: Curry helped ignite a fourth-quarter rally that brought the Warriors within three points after trailing by 20 early in the period. Inexplicably, Golden State coach Keith Smart removed Curry from the game in the final period after he had just scored eight consecutive points for the Warriors and clearly was their hot hand. Curry added six assists, two steals, one blocked shot, one rebound and five turnovers in the loss.
News: Curry scored 39 points (14-of-20 FG, 4-of-7 3pt, 7-of-7 FT) in 46 minutes in Sunday's loss to the Thunder.

Impact: This was Ellis' second 48-minute effort in his last three games as he once again shows himself to be a minutes iron man upon demand.  The one concerning aspect of his game recently is his free-throw shooting, as he has made only 16 of 27 free throws in his last five games.
News: Ellis exploded for 38 points (16-for-27 FG, 3-for-7 FT) with seven assists, four boards, three treys and a steal while playing all 48 minutes on Thursday against the Suns.

Impact: Gadzuric, who started the previous four games, was needed when Adris Biedrins picked up his fourth foul late in the first half. He was on the floor to start the second half when the Warriors outscored the Timberwolves, 36-17, in the third quarter to take control. With Lee's return, Gadzuric will get sporadic minutes wherever needed and will occasionally contribute in some meaningful way.
News: Gadzuric was moved back to the bench with the return of David Lee (elbow) and played 18 minutes with eight points, two rebounds, two assists and a blocked shot in Golden State's win over Minnesota on Saturday.
