Impact: Lee went 9-of-22 from the field, and while his shooting percentages are down this season, he's averaged 5.2 assists over the past five games and looks close to being back to 100 percent healthy. His numbers should only improve from here on out.
News: Lee finished Tuesday's loss with 20 points, eight rebounds, seven assists and a steal.

Impact: The rookie totaled six more points than he had his entire season, and his first points came in a loss to LA on Oct. 31. He's the first Harvard player in the NBA since Ed Smith played 11 games for the Knicks back in 1953-54.
News: Lin scored 13 points and added three rebounds - both career highs - in Sunday night's 117-89 loss to the Lakers.

Impact: The Warriors' lack of frontcourt depth is showing with Lee having missed the last six games. A few days ago, coach Keith Smart was praising Radmanovic, but the coach pulled him early on in Sunday's loss against the Lakers after a couple of turnovers, and Radmanovic has fallen out of rotation for now. Lee isn't expected to return until next week at the earliest, so Radmanovic could find himself back in the rotation, but he wasn't producing much before and isn't a very good fantasy option if he's not knocking down his jumpers.
News: After starting the last three games at power forward, Radmanovic was a DNP in Monday night's loss to the Nuggets. Radmanovic had been starting in place of the injured David Lee (elbow), but was replaced by Dan Gadzuric on Monday.

INJURY STATUS: 10/28/2010Day to day. (Right wrist surgery - out 2 months)
Impact: It sounds like he could be back before the All-Star break and perhaps a lot sooner. Regardless, he'll be a rotation player at best for the Warriors and nor relevant in fantasy leagues as a rookie.
News: CSN Bay Area reports that  Ekpe Udoh has been cleared to increase his workload and will begin to travel with the team. He broke his wrist in July and his original time table didn't have him back in action until February.

Impact: Wright was at practice Wednesday, but didn't participate. He'll miss his seventh straight game Thursday because of the back. There's still no timetable for a return, but perhaps we'll get more information pending this weekend's evaluation.
News: Wright will have his strained lower back re-evaluated before the Warriors head out on the road Sunday, the San Jose Mercury News reports.

Impact: Wright is averaging a career-high 15.0 points in his first season with the Warriors.
News: Wright scored 17 points and tied a season-high with 11 rebounds in Golden State's 105-100 loss Tuesday against Dallas.

Impact: Aminu is coming on strong with an average of 13.4 points in his last five games. He could provide a boost to a slumping fantasy lineup.
News: Aminu scored 17 points in a 113-11 loss at Minnesota on Wednesday.

Impact: The injury explains his two-point performance over only 11 minutes Friday.  The good news is that he's still got a shot to play tomorrow, so the issue might not be as serious as it sounds.  Stay tuned.
News: Eric  Bledsoe  is questionable for Sunday's game after suffering a high ankle sprain in yesterday's loss to the Suns, according to the Los Angeles Times.

Impact: Butler's hands are the key to his value as a long-range shooter. It could be a few weeks before he's all healed up.
News: Butler (finger) toughed out 11 minutes with two points and two assists in Monday's win over the Hornets.

Impact: Davis has given the Clippers a boost since his return, but has yet to reclaim the starting point guard spot. The ongoing injury woes make him frustrating to own, but he's a solid contributor when healthy.
News: Davis (hamstring) will be a game-time decision Wednesday against the Lakers,  Lisa Dillman of the Los Angeles Times reports.

Impact: If for some reason you're still hanging onto him, it's probably time to cut him loose. Eric Bledsoe and Baron Davis are locked into the top two point guard spots, leaving only a scraps of playing time for Foye when he does return.
News: Foye (hamstring) sat out his fourth straight game Sunday against the Trail Blazers.

Impact: Coach Vinny Del Negro is loving this effort after Gomes totaled 14 points over his previous five games.
News: Gomes scored 20 points Friday in a 116-108 loss at Phoenix.

Impact: Gordon's performance against the Kings extended his stretch of at least 20 points to nine consecutive games. He's averaging 25.7 points in that stretch while connecting on 47.1 percent of his shots.
News: Gordon scored 29 points to lead the Clippers to a 98-91 win over Sacramento on Monday.

Impact: Griffin's ninth consecutive double-double was quiet, but the two blocks were a nice addition to his usually gaudy stat line. Griffin's past five games of 23.4 points and 13 rebounds per game are enough to wash away any doubts of a drop in numbers.
News: Griffin had 13 points, 11 rebounds and seven assists in Monday's victory over the Kings.

Impact: Jordan's 13 boards and three blocks looked more like the numbers expected from a starting NBA center. Unfortunately, he also continued his putrid free-throw shooting with an 0-for-4 performance bringing his average to 41-percent. He's limited, real limited.
News: DeAndre Jordan had two points, 13 rebounds, three block and an assist in 34 minutes Wednesday.

Impact: Kaman could be out for a while again. He could be weeks away from being 100 percent and it would be wise to look to wire for a suitable replacement.
News: Kaman's (ankle) MRI revealed a deep bone bruise, Lisa Dillman of the Los Angeles Times reports.

Impact: Smith gets the nod with Randy Foye (hamstring) not playing tonight.  Smith had been dealing with a back injury, but he's apparently back to business.  He'll backup Blake Griffin.
News: Craig Smith will be activated for Saturday's game, according to Lisa Dillman of the Los Angeles Times.

Impact: Warren averaged a team-best 16.3 points, 3.3 rebounds and 4.1 assists in 21 games as a sophomore last season for Oklahoma. He was a teammate of Clippers forward Blake Griffin at Oklahoma in 2008-09.
News: The Los Angeles Clippers have signed Warren, their second-round selection in the NBA draft.

Impact: The Lakers ran Golden State out of the gym in this one, so Artest sat for most of the second half and played just 21 minutes total. His scoring will hover around 10 points per game, but he does enough in the other categories to make him worth using in deeper leagues.
News: Artest had just two points on 1-of-3 shooting in Sunday's win over the Warriors. He added three assists, two steals and two blocks.

Impact: Barnes probably deserves his own feature on NBATV after that amazing performance. It certainly helped a lot of owners in deep leagues that had Barnes rostered, but his general limited production means his stellar night ultimately meant very little in the realm of fantasy.
News: Barnes was offensively perfect Friday. He finished the Lakers' win over the Timberwolves with 24 points (7-7 FG, 5-5 3PT, 5-5 FT), seven rebounds, six assists, two steals, and zero turnovers in 24 minutes off the bench.

Impact: Blake appears to be over the stomach virus that kept him out of Sunday's game, but he's averaging fewer than 20 minutes per game for the Lakers, which isn't enough time for him to provide much in the way of fantasy-relevant statistics.
News: Blake (stomach virus) had six points, two assists, a rebound and a steal in Tuesday's win over the Bucks.

Impact: A native of Maywood, Illinois, Brown is averaging 19.0 points on this homestand. He's deserving of some key fantasy minutes since the defending NBA champions are so loaded he's capable of putting up gaudy numbers for coach Phil Jackson.
News: Brown matched his season high with 21 points, hitting five 3-pointers against his hometown team, in the Los Angeles Lakers' fifth straight victory, 98-91 over the Chicago Bulls on Tuesday night.

Impact: As perhaps expected, Bryant has proved fairly consistent this season in scoring at least 20 points in all but one game.
News: Bryant scored a season-high 41 points but missed two tying 3-point attempts in the final seconds of the Indiana Pacers' first victory over the Los Angeles Lakers at Staples Center, 95-92 on Sunday night.

Impact: Bynum's rehab has ramped up recently, but this is the first time he has targeted a specific game. He was originally expected to make a return near the end of the Lakers' upcoming six-game road trip, but a return on Dec. 14 would actually be the night before the team hits the road. Weekly leagues will have a tough decision when setting their lineups for the next period.
News: Bynum (knee) hopes to return Dec. 14 against the Wizards.

Impact: He averaged 15.4 points, 8.6 rebounds and 1.4 blocks starting all five games for the Lakers' entry in the Las Vegas summer league.  Caracter averaged 14.1 points and 8.1 rebounds at UTEP last season. He played his first two seasons at Louisville before transferring for his junior year.
News: The Los Angeles Lakers have signed Caracter. The 22-year-old forward was taken with the 58th pick in the June draft.

Impact: The rookie from West Virginia has averaged 3.0 points in eight games this season. The Los Angeles Times reported earlier this month that the forward could head to the Development League.
News: Ebanks didn't play while battling the flu, leaving Los Angeles with just 11 players in uniform for Monday night's 95-92 loss to Indiana.

Impact: The veteran point guard announced Monday in a statement on his website that he'll re-sign with the Lakers. The five-time NBA champion entertained offers from other teams as a free agent, including a recent conversation with the Miami Heat. He decided not to leave the franchise where he has spent 11 of his 14 NBA seasons.
News: Fisher says he's staying with the Los Angeles Lakers.

Impact: Gasol has been bothered by a strained left hamstring, but he was able to suit up Friday after a day of treatment on the injury. With the Lakers up big in the second half, they didn't need Gasol at all in the fourth quarter, allowing him to get some added rest.
News: Gasol (hamstring) had 16 points, five rebounds, five assists and three blocks in Friday's 113-80 win over the Kings.

Impact: Odom's strong night came on 11-of-16 shooting, including 2-of-4 from three-point range. His production will probably take a slight hit when Andrew Bynum returns within the next couple of weeks, but Odom has been a steady force for the Lakers this season and should continue to be productive.
News: Odom had 25 points, 11 rebounds, two blocks, two assists and a steal in Wedneday's loss to the Rockets.

Impact: "He's moving along quickly" coach Phil Jackson said Friday, which is obviously good news. When healthy, Ratliff has some value as a shot-blocker, at least while Andrew Bynum is still out.
News: Ratliff (knee) is still about two weeks away from returning from knee surgery,  Mike Bresnahan of the LA Times reports.

Impact: Vujacic said he proposed on the one-year anniversary of their first meeting at a friend's barbecue. "It's was probably old school,'' Vujacic said. "I had to do it like a gentlemen.'' Vujacic said a wedding date hasn't been set. The Slovenian guard returned to action Thursday, a week after getting a concussion when teammate Lamar Odom accidentally elbowed him in the face during practice. Vujacic averaged 2.8 points and 1.2 rebounds in 67 games for the Lakers last season.
News: Vujacic says he's engaged to marry Russian tennis star Maria Sharapova. "We are engaged and are both really happy,'' Vujacic said Thursday night before the Lakers' exhibition game against Golden State. ``It's good and now we can focus on other things.''

Impact: A benchwarmer who receives few minutes on one of the most talented rosters in the sport, Walton has no fantasy value.
News: Walton is out with a hamstring injury.

Impact: Barron again started at power forward, but he couldn't get anything going offensively. For that matter, neither could Hakim Warrick (no points in seven minutes) or Hedo Turkoglu (six points in 19 minutes). The power forward position in Phoenix is basically a mess right now.
News: Barron had just six points and two rebounds in Friday's win over the Pacers.

Impact: "The way he played, we have to stick him out there for a few minutes when the game isn't a blowout and see if he can step up and play," coach Alvin Gentry said. There are a lot of bodies in the Suns frontcourt for Clark to climb over before he starts getting enough minutes to be worth fantasy consideration, though.
News: Clark may have earned himself more playing time with his performance on Thursday, when he scored 12 points with six rebounds in 16 minutes, the Arizona Republic reports.

Impact: Nash actually took some shooting drills before the game, so it's unlikely he'll be ceding his post to Dragic much longer. If there's value in tonight's performance, it's that coach Alvin Gentry won't hesitate to give big minutes/responsibility to Dragic.
News: Starting his second consecutive game in place of injured point guard Steve Nash (groin), Dragic played 38 minutes en route to 17 points (6-13 FG, 1-4 3Pt, 4-4 FT), four rebounds, and 10 assists Saturday night at Charlotte.

Impact: Dudley will modestly go off from time to time, but never enough to warrant a full-time gig in a starting fantasy lineup. He hasn't seen more than 20 minutes in any game this season as coach Alvin Gentry juggles new faces and what has been a consistent 10-man rotation.
News: Dudley posted season-highs in points (15) and rebounds (six) in 20 minutes off the bench in Phoenix' win over Atlanta on Sunday.

Impact: Frye has been inconsistent at times this year, but he's now averaging 16.2 points over his last five games (including more than two three-pointers per game). With the power forward spot a jumbled mess right now, Frye seems like a potential candidate to slide over to the four when Robin Lopez returns from injury later this month.
News: Frye poured in 29 points on 11-of-16 shooting, including five three-pointers, in Friday's win over the Pacers. He added five rebounds, three blocks and two steals.

Impact: Hill showed no signs of his foot injury with his efficient play on Thursday, and he is now averaging 18.2 points on 64 percent shooting from the field with 4.8 boards and 3.6 assists over his last five games.
News: Hill (foot) scored 24 points on a near-perfect 9-for-11 shooting from the field and 6-for-6 from the line Thursday night.  He also added three boards and an assist in his 29 minutes of play.

Impact: Lawal's athleticism made him a popular choice as a first-rounder in pre-draft reports, but his shooting woes and inability to dominate in any one area caused him to drop to 46th overall.  His deal is not guaranteed, but it does increase his chance of making the team.
News: Rookie second-rounder  Gani Lawal has agreed to terms on a contract with the Suns, according to the Arizona Republic.

Impact: The initial report was one to two weeks, then a team statement said several weeks, and now the word is that Lopez will be out at least a month. "It's a little more serious than we first thought it would be," president of basketball operations Lon Babby said. "It was a moderate sprain as opposed to a mild sprain." Considering Lopez was averaging just 5.3 points and 4.3 rebounds in less than 20 minutes per game even when healthy, he can probably be dropped in many leagues to free up a roster spot. Coach Alvin Gentry said Channing Frye will likely continue to start at center.
News: The Arizona Republic now reports that Lopez's sprained knee will keep him out for at least a month.

Impact: Nash has seven straight games of 10 or more assists.
News: Nash scored 24 points and had 15 assists in Phoenix's 106-99 loss Tuesday aganist Portland

Impact: Over his last five games, Richardson is averaging 27.0 points per game. Phoenix relies on him to fill it up, so look for him to continue his hot start to this season.
News: Richardson scored 21 points (7-13 FG, 4-8 3pt, 3-4 FT) and had three steals in 31 minutes in Sunday's win against Washington.

Impact: Coach Alvin Gentry started Earl Barron at power forward, bringing both Turkoglu and Hakim Warrick off the bench. This situation is pretty fluid right now, and Turkoglu is going to be a tough play in most leagues unless he starts producing more consistently.
News: Turkoglu had nine points, seven rebounds and an assist in Thursday's win over the Warriors.

Impact: Warrick played the majority of the minutes at power forward for Phoenix, as Earl Barron played just 17 minutes as the starter. Keep in mind that he had done next to nothing in his previous three games, so this is no guarantee that he's ready to be productive again on a regular basis. If it's enough to convince the Suns to put him back in the starting lineup, however, his value will get a boost.
News: Warrick scored 18 of his 26 points (10-13 FG) in the first half in Sunday's win against Washington. He played 29 minutes off the pine and also grabbed six rebounds.

Impact: Caspi went 8-of-11 from the field, adding two 3-pointers and a steal in 34 minutes off the bench. The 21 points and 10 boards were both season highs.
News: Casspi scored 21 points and pulled down 10 rebounds during the Kings' loss Monday.

Impact: Cousins has posted 32 points, 18 rebounds, and two blocks over the last two games (both starts), and he should continue to excel as long as he is logging around 30 minutes per night.
News: The Kings will continue to operate with  DeMarcus Cousins as the starting center and Samuel Dalembert coming off the bench, the Sacramento Bee reports.

Impact: Dalembert has come off the bench over the last two games, but the Kings attributed that move to injury. This is a more permanent switch. Dalembert should continue to see 20-22 minutes per night and be an option for teams desperate for blocks and rebounds.
News: Samuel Dalembert will continue to come off the bench behind DeMarcus Cousins. &quot;It's different,&quot; Dalembert admits to the Sacramento Bee. &quot;It's been seven years since I was coming off the bench, in my rookie and second year.&quot;

Impact: Evans is dealing with a multitude of injuries, but he looked pretty spry in his 41 minutes of court time Saturday. With the defensively-challenged Clippers and Wizards on tap next week, this could be the start of a nice offensive run for last season's Rookie of the Year.
News: Evans poured in 25 points on 11-of-20 shooting, including three three-pointers, in Saturday's loss to the Mavericks. He also chipped in eight assists, five rebounds and a steal.

Impact: Garcia scored six points with two 3-pointers in 21 minutes off the bench.
News: Garcia (illness) returned to action Tuesday.

Impact: The double-double was Greene's first of the season. He has started the last ten straight games for the Kings, but has only reached double-digits in points three times. Despite his bump in playing time he's not consistent enough for fantasy use.
News: Donte Greene double-doubled in Wednesday's 93-79 loss to the Nets, picking up 14 points and ten rebounds.

Impact: Head scored in double digits four of the past five games. He is averaging 11.2 points, 5,0 rebounds and 1.6 treys in five starts. As long as he's starting, Head is worth a look in most mid-sized formats.
News: Head scored 15 points (5-of-10 FG, 2-of-4 3Pt, 3-of-4 FT) and grabbed seven rebounds in Thursday's loss to the Clippers.

Impact: Jackson began last year with Cleveland and appeared in 28 games before moving to Milwaukee when the Cavs waived him to bring back Zydrunas Ilgauskas. Jackson, a second-year forward, played in one game with the Bucks.
News: The Milwaukee Bucks have completed a trade with the Sacramento Kings for forward Jon Brockman in exchange for Jackson and a 2011 second-round pick.

Impact: Jeter had spent the past four seasons playing overseas in the Ukraine, Spain and Israel. He averaged 14.8 points per game for Cleveland in this month's summer league in Las Vegas.
News: The Sacramento Kings have signed Jeter to a one-year contract.

Impact: Starter Jason Thompson had just four points and played only 20 minutes, but Landry couldn't do anything to capitalize on his increased playing time (28 minutes). Sacramento's starting lineup could change again at any time, but relying on Landry right now is not recommended.
News: Landry had just four points on 1-of-6 shooting in Saturday's loss to the Mavericks. He added a steal and a block.

Impact: Thompson averages just 6.6 points but is capable of putting up good numbers on a dreadful Kings team. Keep an eye on his production.
News: Thompson had a season-high 19 points and 10 rebounds in the Kings' 113-80 loss to the Lakers on Friday.

Impact: Although the Kings lost, Udrih's return to the starting lineup produced the kind of immediate offensive results that the team simply wasn't getting from Luther Head. You know by now that no Kings lineup is set in stone, but Udrih certainly appears to have the upper hand right now and is definitely worth investigating if he was cut loose in your league.
News: Udrih was 6-of-11 from the field and 2-of-4 from three-point range on his way to 16 points in Saturday's loss to the Mavericks. He added six assists, three rebounds and a steal.

Impact: The 7-foot, 235-pound Whiteside, left Marshall after his freshman season to enter the NBA draft. He averaged 13.1 points, 8.9 rebounds and 5.35 blocks in 34 games for the Thundering Herd, earning Conference USA's Defensive Player of the Year and Freshman of the Year honors. Whiteside, chosen 33rd overall, set school records for most blocks in a season and career with 182, the fourth-highest season total in Division I history and the second-most by a freshman.
News: The Sacramento Kings signed Whiteside, their second-round draft pick, on Thursday.

Impact: Afflalo has been up and down most of the season but he stepped up huge for Denver on the offensive end Sunday with 11 fourth-quarter points to help seal the club's seventh straight win. The club's starting shooting guard finished 8-of-12 from the field, including 2-of-2 from downtown, and 1-of-2 from the free-throw line.
News: Afflalo had a career-high 25 points to go along with two rebounds, two assists, two blocks and one steal during Denver's win over Memphis on Sunday night.

Impact: The 'Birdman' ranked sixth in the league in blocked shots last season, swatting nearly two shots a game. He averaged a career-high 6.4 rebounds.
News: Andersen is recovering from offseason knee surgery and is expected to be sidelined through the end of the calendar year.

Impact: Anthony finished with 13 points, six rebounds and three assists. Outside of the Phoenix game on Nov. 28 in which he played three minutes and finished 1-of-1 from the field, Anthony has not shot 50 percent or better for nine straight games. During that span he's 62-of-173 (35.8%) from the field, including 4-of-20 from 3-point range, and has also shot just 78-of-97 from the foul line (80.4%). We expect he'll come around eventually, as he does have a lifetime 45.8 FG percentage, but he's clearly struggling to find his range at the present time.
News: Anthony hit just 4-of-20 field goals during Denver's win over Memphis on Sunday night.

Impact: Balkman is out for the sixth straight game, but does not contribute enough to be missed in fantasy leagues.
News: Renaldo Balkman missed tonight's game at Washington due to a strained back, according to the Associated Press.

Impact: Billups has now played two games since returning from his wrist problem and doesn't seem to be bothered by the injury whatsoever. Even if he continues to take it easy in practice, he should be safe to use.
News: Billups (wrist) had 16 points on 4-of-10 shooting, including a three-pointer, in Wednesday's win over the Bucks. He added nine assists, two rebounds and a block.

Impact: Carter, who has played his last four seasons in Denver, averaged 3.3 points and 3.0 rebounds in 54 games last season, spelling Chauncey Billups and Ty Lawson.
News: Carter has signed a one-year league-minimum deal to stay with the Denver Nuggets.

Impact: Forbes added nine rebounds and looks like he is getting more accustomed to coach George Karl's complicated offensive scheme.
News: Forbes scored 19 points in Tuesday's 120-118 win over New York.

Impact: Harrington is averaging just 7.3 points over his last four games, shooting a paltry 28 percent from the field. His combination of rebounding and scoring (including three-pointers) usually makes him worth starting, but there's no question that he's struggling right now.
News: Harrington had three points, six rebounds, a steal and an assist in Friday's win over the Clippers.

Impact: It was easily Nene's best game of the year, and honestly, one of his best all-around games ever. Based on his past history we'd highly recommend listening to trade offers as Nene is extremely streaky and his value may never be higher than it is right now.
News: Nene blew up on Sunday, posting 27 points, 11 rebounds, six assists, two steals and two blocks during Denver's win over Memphis.

Impact: Lawson has shown that he can contribute if given a larger role, but Billups was a game-time decision Friday and is close to a return. When Billups returns, Lawson will likely return to the bench and lose most of his current value.
News: Lawson started a second straight game at point guard in place of the injured Chauncey Billups on Friday and put up 17 points (7-14 FG, 3-6 3PT), one rebound, three assists, and one steal in 34 minutes.

Impact: Martin is in the final year of his contract and has made it clear he won't rush his rehab since he has a big payday upcoming.
News: Martin is recovering from offseason knee surgery and is expected to be sidelined through the end of the calendar year.

Impact: Smith had scored 20 or more points in three straight games until Sunday. We still think he has some value in deep leagues that value 3-pointers, but outside of that he just isn't seeing enough minutes or doing enough of anything else to justify a fantasy roster spot in shallow formats.
News: Smith had just five points on 1-of-8 shooting during Denver's nail-biting victory over Memphis on Sunday night.

Impact: Though Williams continues to start at power forward, he rarely is getting more than 20 minutes a night these days. He occasionally puts up some decent numbers, but he's too inconsistent for regular fantasy use.
News: Williams had nine points and nine rebounds in 23 minutes in Sunday's win over Memphis.

Impact: Beasley had missed Minnesota's previous game with an ankle sprain, but he didn't seem to be limited Monday night and should be safe to use going forward.
News: Beasley (ankle) had 25 points, six rebounds, an assist and a block in Monday's loss to the Knicks.

Impact: Brewer has played over 20 minutes in all but two games this season as he's been Minnesota's top option off the bench, but his scoring and shooting has been erratic. He was 6-of-10 from the field on Saturday, which ended an 8-for-25 slump.
News: Brewer scored 15 points with three assists in Saturday's win over Cleveland. He started at shooting guard with Michael Beasley out with a sprained ankle.

Impact: After losing the starting shooting guard job, Ellington was mostly relegated to the bench in December. However, he's played 12 minutes or more each of the last three games, so it looks like he's getting back into the rotation off the bench.
News: Ellington scored 13 points in 26 minutes in Wednesday's loss to Dallas.

Impact: Flynn has already missed more time than initially expected, so we won't get too excited until we know for sure that he is ready. He will eventually regain his starting job but may end up sharing a lot of time with Luke Ridnour.
News: Jonny Flynn (hip) will play in the D League on Friday and Saturday, and if all goes well, he could make his season debut on Tuesday, the Minneapolis Star Tribune reports.

Impact: Hayward was the 30th overall pick from Marquette and came to the Wolves in a trade with Washington. He averaged 13.5 points and 6.6 rebounds in his four-year career.
News: Minnesota signed Hayward, one of their two first-round picks.

Impact: He's been dealing with the flu, but he wants to play tonight. We expect him to, even if Corey Brewer gets the start.  Stay tuned.
News: According to Jerry Zgoda of the Minneapolis Star-Tribune,  Wesley Johnson expects to play Monday night.

Impact: The T-Wolves get back Koufos, the Grizzlies' protected 2011 first-round pick that Utah acquired in a previous trade, and another future protected first-round pick. Don't expect Koufos to log many minutes, even in Minnesota.
News: Kosta Koufos has been dealt to Minnesota as part of Utah's trade for Al Jefferson, according to NBA.com.

Impact: Love made 10-of-18 shots from the field and 10-of-10 attempts from the line, also adding three assists and a steal without committing a single turnover. He's the current favorite to lead the NBA in rebounding this season.
News: Love had another big double-double Monday, scoring 33 points while pulling down 15 rebounds during Minnesota's loss.

Impact: We'll have to see whether he's able to practice Tuesday, but he'll likely be a game-time decision for Wednesday's game against Oklahoma City.
News: Milicic, who hurt his quad in the first half of Monday's loss to the Knicks, didn't feel well after the game. "A lot of pain," he told the Minneapolis Star Tribune. "Just try and see how it feels tomorrow because I don't want to miss too much."

Impact: The 2008 second-round pick, who missed the last nine games with the injury, has averaged 5.5 points and 3.3 rebounds this season. Several Timberwolves big men would have to suffer injuries for Pekovic to be fantasy relevant.
News: The Timberwolves have activated  Nikola Pekovic (foot), according to Timberwolves PR.

Impact: It looks like Ridnour will start to get the majority of minutes at point guard over Sebastian Telfair (who had just 12 minutes Wednesday). That may change when Jonny Flynn returns, but Flynn's comeback from a hip injury continues to be delayed.
News: Ridnour scored seven points with five assists in 41 minutes in Wednesday's loss to the Spurs. He started at point guard for the first time since coming back from a hamstring injury.

Impact: Telfair had been in the starting lineup, but Luke Ridnour finally took back the starting point guard job after coming back from a strained hamstring. With Jonny Flynn due back at some point in the next few weeks, Telfair's playing time may continue to decrease.
News: Telfair scored three points with five assists in just 12 minutes and came off the bench in Wednesday's loss to the Spurs.

Impact: Tolliver, however, doesn't plan on being out that long. The 25-year-old Tolliver is planning on a quicker timeline that the one announced by the team before Monday night's game at the New York Knicks. He averaging 6.4 points in his first season for the banged-up Timberwolves, who already are playing without guard Jonny Flynn and forward Martell Webster.
News: Tolliver will miss six to eight weeks with a sprained right knee ligament.

Impact: Expect his minutes to be limited at first as he gets back into shape, but he could quickly become a major factor in the offense when back to full speed.
News: Webster (back) could play as early as Wednesday if cleared by doctors on Tuesday, the Minneapolis Star Tribune reports. More likely he'll return this weekend, the report adds.

Impact: Aldridge is averaging 18.7 points and 9.7 rebounds as Portland has dropped its last six.
News: Aldridge finished with 16 points and 15 rebounds in Friday's 83-79 loss to Washington.

Impact: However, reports have the Timberwolves dealing him to the Blazers. Stay tuned.
News: Luke Babbitt was selected by the Minnesota Timberwolves with the 16th overall pick in Thursday evening's NBA Draft.

Impact: Batum has been productive in his last two games off the bench and has an opportunity for a really strong game as a starter on Tuesday, especially against a Phoenix team that is giving up more points than any other team in the league.
News: Batum will start in place of suspended point guard Andre Miller on Tuesday against the Suns, The Oregonian reports.

Impact: Camby came back with a vengeance after a brutal game Friday night. We question how long his legs will hold up if he keeps playing 38 minutes like he did Sunday, but it looks like he's back on track.
News: Camby had 12 points and snared 19 rebounds in Sunday's win over the Clippers.

Impact: Fernandez hoists up a lot of three-pointers, so even when he's not shooting incredibly well, he still manages to contribute in that category (1.8 threes per game).
News: Fernandez had 12 points on 3-of-10 shooting (all three-point attempts) in Saturday's loss to Utah.

Impact: He's not going to take over for Andre Miller anytime soon, but his performances are what made Jerryd Bayless expendable. Drafted in the second round of this summer's draft, Johnson is a name to know in dynasty leagues. And somewhere, Kevin Pritchard is looking for a job.
News: The Oregonian reports that  Armon Johnson is winning over fans, coaches, and teammates in Portland. He's scored 10 points in each of his last five games and dolled out five assists to go with 4-of-4 shooting in last night's win over the Bucks.

Impact: Marks has missed the Blazers' last two games with an ankle injury. He's 35-years-old, and the chances of him getting enough playing time at any point this season are essentially void.
News: Marks (ankle) will be active for Wednesday's game against the Celtics, the Blazers' official site reports.

Impact: Matthews denied that he went onto the court, and apparently the league agrees. He's on a roll offensively right now and will look to keep things going Tuesday against the Suns.
News: Matthews will not be suspended for leaving the bench area during a scuffle in Sunday's game against the Clippers.

Impact: Mills could be useful for fantasy teams on Tuesday night, and Miller will be back on Thursday. Miller still has a three-game week, so it's not a total disaster for weekly fantasy leagues.
News: Andre Miller has been suspended one game by the NBA for his altercation with Blake Griffin on Sunday. He will miss Tuesday's game against the Suns, and Patrick Mills will likely start in his place, the Oregonian reports.

Impact: So much for Mills having value as a spot starter. He'll be in his usual backup role Tuesday.
News: Contrary to what he said earlier, coach Nate McMillan said that Nicolas Batum -- not Mills -- will start in place of suspended point guard Andre Miller on Tuesday against Phoenix, The Oregonian reports.

Impact: Oden, who is out for the season, has managed to play in just 82 games since being drafted No. 1 overall by the Blazers in 2007. Portland will monitor his rehab process closely before making a decision on his future with the team.
News: Blazers president Larry Miller said he foresees the team making an $8.8 million qualifying offer to retain Oden (knee) next offseason, the Oregonian reports.

Impact: "She was one of my favorite people in the world," Przybilla said of the woman you may remember from January 2009, when she popped up in the news for threatening to write a letter of protest to commissioner David Stern when the league fined Przybilla for an on-court altercation. Przybilla is expected to return for Sunday's game against the Spurs.
News: Przybilla will miss Friday's game at Phoenix, and possibly Thursday's game against Orlando, in order to attend his grandmother-in-law's funeral, The Oregonian reports.

Impact: Roy has had ominous issues with his knee this season that have limited his production and kept him off the court several nights. His ability to put up numbers across the board when healthy makes it hard to deal him away, but his inability to stay on the court begs that he be traded before a more serious issue arises.
News: Roy (knee) will not have any minute restrictions placed on him for Wednesday's game against the Celtics despite it being the second game of a back-to-back set, the Blazers' official site reports.

Impact: The rookie guard, a first-round pick, has yet to make his NBA debut for the Blazers.
News: The Blazers announced Thursday that Williams will have surgery to repair a dislocated right patella, an injury that will likely cost him the season.

Impact: Aldrich was the No. 11 pick in this year's draft. He is in the NBDL for some seasoning before he gets back to the Thunder.
News: Oklahoma City sent Aldrich to its NBA Development League affiliate in Tulsa.

Impact: Collison provides the Thunder with steady play off the bench, but his role as a reserve limits his fantasy potential. Nenad Krstic is also in the last year of his deal, and with Collison re-inking and Serge Ibaka's development, Krstic could find himself playing elsewhere next year (or sooner).
News: The Thunder signed Collison to a four-year extension Tuesday,  The Oklahoman reports.

Impact: Obviously an attempt by Miami to clear even more cap space for this summer's looming free agent bonanza. In 45 games last season, Cook averaged just five points and 15 and a half minutes per contest.
News: According to Yahoo! Sports, the Heat have traded guard  Daequan Cook and the 18th pick in Thursday's draft to the Thunder for the 32nd pick.

Impact: Durant went 7-of-18 from the field and a perfect 14-of-14 from the line in 33 minutes of run. He's been outplayed by teammate Russell Westbrook early on, but Durant is still clearly one of the best fantasy options around, and no one is a bigger help in the free throw category. Expect the FG percentage to increase from here on out as well.
News: Durant finished Monday's loss with 29 points, five rebounds, two steals and two blocks.

Impact: Durant was a game-time decision, which means he's likely to play Friday at Toronto. This was a nice game for Green owners, but not necessarily indicative of anything to come for the Thunder power forward.
News: With Kevin Durant (knee) out, Green took on a prominent role in Wednesday's triple-overtime victory at New Jersey, scoring a career-high 37 points (12-21 FG, 4-5 3Pt, 9-9 FT).

Impact: Harden was a bigger part of the offense for a second straight game with Kevin Durant missing a another game due to a sore knee. The only things stopping Harden from being a dominant player in the NBA and fantasy are the guys ahead of him on the depth chart. Ride him as long as Durant is out, but know that the return of Durant will mean a reduced role for Harden.
News: Harden displayed his offensive prowess Friday in the Thunder's loss to the Raptors. He put up 20 points (5-14 FG, 3-7 3Pt, 7-8 FT), four rebounds and three assists in 30 minutes.

Impact: Ibaka is averaging 10.8 points and 6.9 boards in his second NBA season.
News: Ibaka did not scored in 30 minutes of Monday's win over New Orleans, but did match a season high with 11 rebounds. He was ejected from the game when he was called for a flagrant foul for hitting Chris Paul with his elbows as he cleared space after a rebound with 2:52 left in the third quarter

Impact: General manager Sam Presti announced Wednesday that Oklahoma City had signed the 6-foot-4 guard, who has averaged 3.6 points in six NBA seasons with Atlanta, Milwaukee and Philadelphia. Presti says Ivey will bring a defensive mentality, competitive nature and professionalism to the team. Terms of the deal were not disclosed.
News: The Thunder have signed Ivey to add depth to their backcourt.

Impact: Krstic totaled three points and seven rebounds in 17 minutes. He'll get more minutes as he gets stronger.
News: Krstic returned to action Monday after missing two games with back spasms.

Impact: Maynor, a 6-3 rookie point guard in 2009-10, averaged 4.7 points and 3.3 assists per game in 81 contests between the Jazz and Thunder. With Indiana already having a glut of point guards, the potential deal seems a tad curious. Stay tuned.
News: According to Yahoo! Sports, the &quot;Thunder are holding serious talks&quot; with the Pacers about trading Eric Maynor and the 18th and 21st picks in tomorrow's draft to the Pacers for their 10th overall selection.

Impact: He should see some time tonight with the starters unlikely to get their typical workload given that the Thunder are locked into the No. 8 seed.
News: The Thunder have recalled  B.J. Mullens from the D-League, according to the Oklahoman's Darnell Mayberry.

Impact: With Kevin Durant out, minutes filtered down to the bottom of the roster where Peterson safely resides. He has seen action in just three games this season, playing a total of 16 minutes. Don't expect that to change anytime soon.
News: Peterson made his first appearance since Nov. 19, finishing with two points in nine minutes for the Thunder on Friday.

Impact: Sefolosha has seen his minutes and production rise recently. In his last five games, he's averaged 10 points, 7.2 rebounds, 1.6 assists, 1.2 steals, and 0.4 three-pointers in 36 minutes. The Thunder rely on Sefolosha for his defensive contributions. He'll never be a considerable force of offense on their team, but he can put up good all-around numbers if he's playing 36 minutes per game.
News: Sefolosha put up 13 points (4-6 FG, 1-2 3PT, 4-4 FT), 10 rebounds, and an assist in 46 minutes Friday.

Impact: You could use any number of superlatives to describe Westbrook's effort so far this season, but perhaps most important for his fantasy value is his improvement in the free-throw category. Westbrook is converting over four more free throws per game this season than last -- and at a higher rate. That helps him considerably both in free throws and in points scored.
News: Westbrook led the Thunder in points, rebounds, assists, steals, and free-throws made Wednesday night in the team's triple-overtime victory at New Jersey.

Impact: White was reportedly available for the game, but this may have been a case where coach Scott Brooks was being overly cautious. For much of the game, the Thunder were comfortably ahead, before the Warriors made a fourth-quarter push.
News: White, who left Oklahoma City's previous game with an ankle injury, did not play in Sunday's game against Golden State.

Impact: Bell has been battling injuries so far this year but has been having some decent scoring nights lately. He has been an inconsistent shooter, but scored double-figures in four of the last five games. If his minutes continue to increase, he could give fantasy owners a nice scoring boost.
News: Bell hit four of his five three-point attempts Monday and finished with 14 points. He also added three rebounds and two assists.

Impact: Elson had been bothered by an inner ear problem, but he should be good to go now.
News: Elson (ear) had four points and a rebound in Friday's loss to the Mavericks.

Impact: Evans is not a rising talent so fantasy owners shouldn't concern themselves with when he will play for Utah.
News: The Jazz lost Evans to a sprained right wrist in the first quarter Sunday at Oklahoma City.

Impact: Fesenko was wearing a heavy protective boot Tuesday and said his ankle has swollen considerably since Monday night. He does not know how much time he might miss.
News: Fesenko suffered a sprained left ankle during the fourth quarter of Monday's win against Memphis, the Salt Lake Tribune reports. He did not practice Tuesday and is doubtful for Wednesday's game against Miami.

Impact: Hayward's most extensive action came in a loss to Phoenix on Oct. 28 when he played 25 minutes and scored six points and added six rebounds.
News: Hayward will start for the Jazz on Monday night against Oklahoma City in place of Raja Bell, who has a groin injury.

Impact: Jefferson shot just 5-of-13, adding just one assist and one block, but he did his job and did it well.  He's double-doubled in three of his past four games, averaging 9.8 boards and 17.3 points over that time.
News: Al Jefferson pulled down 10 rebounds and scored 12 points in Utah's 94-85 win over the Grizzlies.

Impact: Kirilenko continues to maintain a steady level of productivity as a starter so far this season, but has not had a blowout game. He has scored in double-figures in every game this season except three, but has yet to score 20 or more. He has also managed to record just one double-double.
News: Kirilenko scored 18 points (6-15 FG, 5-6 FT) and grabbed seven rebounds in Wednesday's game. He also added two steals and a block.

Impact: Miles had his best game in a while on Monday, as it had been more than two weeks since he has scored at least 20 points. He was aggressive offensively, taking 14 shots, including seven three-point attempts in the win.
News: Miles hit three 3-pointers and scored 20 points in Monday's win against the Grizzlies. He also added three assists, two steals and two blocks to complete a solid stat line.

Impact: In Friday's game Millsap scored at least 20 points for the first time since mid-November. He has been putting up decent numbers, but the big numbers we have seen from him in the past may not be there so much this year as he has to share the ball on offense with another very good big man in Al Jefferson.
News: Millsap scored a team-high 21 points (6-10 FG and 9-14 FT) in a home loss to Dallas Friday. He grabbed seven rebounds and added two assists and two blocks.

Impact: While this is certainly good news, unfortunately Okur still doesn't have a timetable for his return. His comeback seems to be on the horizon, though, so feel free to stash him on your bench if he's available in your league.
News: Okur said he's 100-percent healed from his Achilles injury, the Desert News reports.

Impact: Price is still recovering from a bruised wrist, and doesn't score enough to be missed in fantasy leagues.
News: Ronnie Price won't play in tonight's game against Washington, according to Ben Bagley's (KFAN 1320) twitter page.

Impact: Watson has been playing well off the bench lately. He will occasionally give Deron Williams added rest by coming off the bench during the year and is known to put up big games like the one Monday against the Bucks. Don't expect the same production from him routinely though, unless an injury strikes one of the players ahead of him on the depth chart.
News: Watson hit two three-pointers and scored 12 points in 27 minutes off the bench Monday. He added seven assists, six rebounds, two steals and a block in his best game of the year.

Impact: Williams' performance against the Grizzlies was a welcome change after he struggled in a loss to Dallas three nights prior. He had scored 12 points on 4 for 13 from the field against the Mavericks. Despite that performance, Williams is a consistent fantasy contributor.
News: Williams scored 27 points while dishing out eight assists in the Jazz's 94-85 win over Memphis on Monday.

Impact: Ajinca was called into duty with Tyson Chandler sidelined by a stomach bug. He is not fantasy relevant.
News: Ajinca saw his first action in 13 games, scoring three points and collecting six rebounds Tuesday.

Impact: Barea had scored double-digits in three consecutive games prior to Friday. A career 33 percent three-pointer shooter, Barea is struggling from behind the arc this season and has connected on just 7-of-44 attempts (16 percent).
News: Barea was limited to eight points Friday as Dallas outlasted Utah. He finished 3-of-8 from the field and 2-of-2 from the line.

Impact: Beaubois will attend the Texas Legends' home opener but will not play. Owner Mark Cuban called it "a marketing support move for the Legends." In other words, this isn't a rehab stint for Beaubois, it's simply a marketing attempt to boost D-League ticket sales. Beaubois remains at least three weeks away from returning.
News: The Mavericks assigned Beaubois (foot) to the D-League on Tuesday, NBA.com's John Schuhmann reports.

Impact: Butler played 26 minutes as he continues to split time with Shawn Marion. He is averaging a career-low 29.8 minutes per game.
News: Butler scored 13 points on 4-of-10 shooting Saturday. He added five rebounds and a steal.

Impact: He could see a bit of time as a player capable of doing the dirty work, but he won't get nearly enough to garner fantasy relevance.
News: Brian Cardinal has been signed by Minnesota, according to NBA.com's Jonah Ballow.

Impact: The league-wide stomach virus strikes again. Brendan Haywood will start in Chandler's place Tuesday, and since most players hit with the virus have been missing a few days, Chandler should be considered questionable for Thursday's game against the Nets.
News: Chandler (illness) is inactive for Tuesday's game against the Warriors, Mavs.com's Earl K. Sneed reports.

Impact: Haywood has been more active since serving a team-mandated one-game suspension. However, his numbers continue to be too inconsistent to warrant a fantasy roster spot.
News: Haywood scored nine points and blocked three shots on Saturday as Dallas won their ninth consecutive game.

Impact: The Grizzlies drafted the 6-foot-4, 215-pound Jones out of South Florida with the 25th overall pick. The guard from Lake Wales, Fla., led the Bulls in scoring each of his three seasons and was the nation's only college player to average at least 21 points, six rebounds and three assists.
News: The Dallas Mavericks have signed first-round draft pick Jones, whose rights they bought from the Memphis Grizzlies on draft day. Terms weren't disclosed.

Impact: Kidd has struggled with his shot recently, shooting 14-of-42 (33 percent) from the field in Dallas' last five games.
News: Kidd shot an unimpressive 2-of-10 from the field, including 1-of-8 on three-pointers Saturday. He finished with eight points, five assists, and five rebounds in the win.

Impact: As if Dallas needed another reason to limit Brendan Haywood's minutes.  Haywood played only 18 despite starting, and Mahinmi's double-double could earn him some more time going forward.
News: With Tyson Chandler out,  Ian Mahinmi took advantage of a season-high 21 minutes, scoring 12 points and adding 10 rebounds in a 105-100 win over the Warriors.

Impact: Marion has not scored in double figures in Dallas' last two games after doing so in the previous five outings. Look for him to continue to share time with Caron Butler.
News: Marion tallied just four points Saturday as Dallas won its ninth straight game. He did manage to grab eight rebounds and block one shot.

Impact: The 6-foot-10 Novak spent the past two seasons with the Los Angeles Clippers. He also played two seasons for the Houston Rockets after they drafted him in the second round in 2006. He has career averages of 4.1 points and 1.1 rebounds in 195 games.
News: The Dallas Mavericks have signed Novak. Terms of the deal announced Thursday weren't released.

Impact: Nowitzki is averaging 25.1 points per game during Dallas' nine-game winning streak.
News: Nowitzki scored 25 points on 11-of-15 shooting Saturday. He added five rebounds and a block in the win.

Impact: Entering the game, an absurd 20 of Stevenson's 23 shots on the season were of the three-point variety. He's only a 34% shooter on his career, but is now 13-for-23 on the season and appears to be becoming a bit of an outside specialist. If he somehow got 25-plus minutes on the court, he'd have some value as a shooting guard.
News: Stevenson was perfect from the floor Saturday at Atlanta, going 3-for-3 from behind the arc and 4-for-4 overall in 18 minutes.

Impact: The 23-point effort was the first time Terry has topped 20 points  since a November 14 win over New Orleans.
News: Terry bounced back from an off-night shooting Friday to score 23 points in Saturday's win over the Kings. He shot 7-of-14 from the field and a perfect 7-of-7 from the line.

Impact: If Battier is out, it'd presumably result in more work for Courtney Lee and Chase Budinger.
News: Battier (illness) will be a game-time decision for Tuesday's game against Detroit, NBA.com writer Jason Friedman reports.

Impact: Brooks could be back later this week, but we'll have a better idea once he returns to a full practice.
News: Brooks (ankle) went through an extensive shooting drill after practice with Chase Budinger on Monday and said he is still targeting Thursday for his return, though he said he has not been told if he has been cleared to practice this week, the Houston Chronicle reports. "It's getting better every day," Brooks said. "I keep working hard, have a great training staff that is very used to this injury."

Impact: Budinger's production runs parallel with the eratic distribution of his minutes. His 29 minutes of action Friday were a personal season-high, and he's played as few as 14 minutes in one game this season. Budinger can contribute in scoring, threes, and rebounds, but he'll struggle to have value in fantasy until he's given 30 minutes nightly.
News: Budinger put up a team-high 19 points (6-15 FG, 3-8 3PT, 4-4 FT) with eight rebounds and four assists in 29 minutes Friday.

Impact: Hayes has started the last three games at center for the Rockets and averaged 24 minutes of court time in those games. It's promising to see Hayes in the starting lineup, but he's unlikely to maintain solid fantasy value unless he starts playing more minutes. Standard leagues can avoid him at this time.
News: Hayes put up six points (3-5 FG), 10 rebounds, an assist, a steal, and a block in 20 minutes Friday.

Impact: Perhaps more importantly, Hill did a good job defensively on Pau Gasol in the second half. Hill is likely to lose minutes when Yao Ming comes back next week, but Yao's no lock to stay healthy, and Hill is the team's most athletic big man. There's a chance Hill pushes for a bigger role at some point in the season.
News: Hill had 10 points, four rebounds, two assists and a block in 28 minutes Wednesday.

Impact: Jeffries is down with a strained left Achilles. He is not productive enough with Houston to be missed in fantasy leagues.
News: Jared Jeffries is expected to miss tonight's game versus Los Angeles, according to ClipsNation.com.

Impact: Lee had only 15 minutes Friday, but someone's got to pick up Budinger's 15-20 minutes should he miss a few games.
News: Lee, who had nine points on 4-of-6 shooting Friday, could see more minutes in the short term with Chase Budinger likely out.

Impact: Lowry's double-doubled in two of his past three games, averaging 9.3 dimes and 22 points over that time.  He's definitely stepped up in Aaron Brooks' absence, and he's been a nice find for owners.
News: Kyle Lowry dished out 12 assists and scored 22 points in Houston's 97-83 win over the Pistons.

Impact: Martin should see his usual 30-35 mpg once he gets well.
News: Martin (flu) played just 28 minutes Saturday, scoring 14 points.

Impact: It's unlikely that Miller is experiencing a renaissance, but it ought to be noted that he's now 16-of-32 on three-pointers this season. Even with him playing 20-25 minutes per game, Miller's rosterable in a four-game week.
News: Miller crossed the 20-point threshold for the second time in as many games, scoring 20 exactly (6-13 FG, 4-9 3Pt, 4-5 FT) while adding three assists and three blocks Saturday at Chicago.

INJURY STATUS: 11/10/2010Day to day. (Strained tendon in left leg)
Impact: Yao may try to practice Wednesday, but there's too much uncertainty here to rely on him in weekly lineup leagues. His earliest possible return will be Friday against the Bucks.
News: Yao (ankle) did not practice Monday and will not play Tuesday, the Houston Chronicle's Jonathan Feigen reports.

Impact: The Rockets chose the 6-foot-9, 236-pound forward from Kentucky with the 14th pick overall in the draft. Patterson scored 18 points in the Rockets' summer-league opener in Las Vegas on Friday. The agreement was first reported by KRIV-TV.
News: The Houston Rockets have reached an agreement with first-round draft pick Patterson. Patterson's agent, Odell McCants, said the deal is a standard rookie contract, with the first two years guaranteed and two one-year options. McCants said Patterson planned to sign the contract after the Rockets' summer league game in Las Vegas on Tuesday night.

Impact: After a hot start, Scola had cooled off a bit recently, but he's capable of 20 points and 10 boards on any given night.
News: Scola had 27 points on 9-of-18 shooting, and added eight rebounds, three assists and a block in 39 minutes Saturday.

Impact: Smith, undrafted out of Wake Forest, had seven points and six assists. He's shooting 25.0 percent so he needs to improve to become a real fantasy factor.
News: Smith made his first start of his career to help the Houston Rockets win their first game of the season with a 120-94 rout of the Minnesota Timberwolves on Sunday night.

Impact: He'll serve as depth in the backcourt until Trevor Ariza (hip) returns to health.
News: The Rockets have recalled  Jermaine Taylor from the D-League, according to NBA.com's Jason Friedman.

Impact: It's odd: coach Lionel Hollins announced just days ago that Allen would find minutes hard to come by, then Allen comes out and posts his second-highest minutes played of the season. In any case, he doesn't hit threes and can't really create his own shot, so he'd have to force a lot of steals to become rosterable.
News: Allen put up a useful line Saturday against his former team, playing 20 minutes and recording 11 points (4-7 FG, 3-4 FT), four rebounds, three assists, and three steals.

Impact: The groin malady had kept him Arthur out of the Grizzlies' two previous games, but it looks like he is ready to resume his regular standing in the rotation at around 20 minutes per game.
News: Arthur (groin) scored seven points and grabbed four rebounds in 19 minutes against the Rockets on Friday.

Impact: Unfortunately, that action only lasted one minute and 57 seconds.
News: Carroll (ankle) saw his first action in nearly a month Wednesday, the Memphis Commercial Appeal reports.

Impact: Conley's performance was superb, but it was only the second time this season that he topped 20 points. He's averaging 14.9 points on the season.
News: Conley scored a season-high 28 points while making 10 of 13 shots in the Grizzlies' 98-96 win over the Los Angeles Lakers on Tuesday.

Impact: The 20-point night was just his second of the season, while the 20-5-5 effort was only the fourth of his career.
News: Marc Gasol scored 20 points to go along with seven rebounds and five assists on Friday evening, but couldn't' prevent Memphis from falling 127-111 to the Rockets.

Impact: Gay's scoring dipped a bit toward the end of November (14.8 ppg in eight games), but is averaging 25 points in three December games. He also blocked five shots in this one.
News: Gay scored a team-high 24 points (8-of-17 FG, 2-of-3 3pt, 6-of-9 FT) in Memphis' loss to Denver on Sunday.

Impact: The seldom used big man has appeared in just four of the Grizzlies' first 15 games. It's still uncertain if he'll see any disciplinary action from the team.
News: Haddadi was charged with assault Thursday morning following an altercation with his girlfriend, the Associated Press reports.

Impact: The move will force OJ Mayo to come off the bench, and it comes after Mayo was benched for showing up late to a shoot-around.  Obviously, this hurts Mayo's fantasy value, and it provides a slight bump for Henry.  Still, we'd avoid Henry for now unless you're in a very deep league.
News: According to the Memphis Commercial Appeal, Coach Lionel Hollins says  Xavier Henry  is the Grizzlies new starting shooting guard.

Impact: This was Mayo's third straight game coming off of the bench, and he posted his best offensive showing in about three weeks. It was his first 20-point game since November 3 and his 57.1 field goal percentage was his best effort of the year. Note the strong performance does not necessarily mean he will launch back into a starting role any time soon, but he does hold fantasy value even as the Grizzlies' sixth man.
News: Mayo had 23 points (8-14 FG, 2-5 3pt, 5-5 FT) in just under 27 minutes against the Warriors Friday.

Impact: Randolph went 8-of-17 from the floor, also adding one steal and two blocks in 40 minutes of action. It was his 12th double-double of the season.
News: Randolph scored 17 points and grabbed 14 rebounds during the Grizzlies' 94-85 loss to the Jazz on Monday.

Impact: It looks like it's safe to assume Thabeet will re-join the rotation when the Grizzlies take on the Mavs on Wednesday. Unfortunately, Thabeet has not performed well when active thus far (a total of nine points and 15 rebounds through seven games).
News: Grizzlies coach Lionel Hollins said Thabeet did not play Monday against the Suns because of the opponent's smaller lineup, the Memphis Flyer reports.

Impact: The short stint on the court followed a DNP on Saturday, and Young's playing time has taken a sharp nosedive of late. He has not racked up double-digit minutes since Nov. 3, and he also had a DNP on Nov. 6. He appears to be healthy, so it looks like coach Lionel Hollins either is not happy with something in Young's play or is simply playing the matchups.
News: Young only played a bit more than two minutes in the Grizzlies' loss Monday.

Impact: Andersen, a backup center, is averaging 5.1 points and 3.1 rebounds.
News: The New Orleans Hornets and Toronto Raptors have agreed in principle on a five-player trade that would send Peja Stojakovic and Jerryd Bayless to the Raptors for Jarrett Jack, Andersen and Marcus Banks, a source told ESPN.com Saturday.

Impact: Ariza benefited from playing the Knicks and the absence of David West (illness). He hadn't taken more than 15 shots in any of the team's previous 18 games. His extended role in the offense will dry up when West returns.
News: Ariza scored a season-high 21 points (9-21 FG, 0-4 3Pt, 3-3 FT) to go with nine rebounds, two assists, and three steals Friday.

Impact: Expect this to be the norm as the Hornets acquired Banks for cap relief next year, not for his contributions on the court.
News: Banks was inactive for the Hornets in his first official game as a team member Monday against the Clippers.

Impact: Not good for Belinelli, whose only value to the Hornets is putting the ball through the hoop.  He doesn't get rebounds, or assists, and his defense leaves a lot to be desired.
News: Belinelli had two points and went 0-for-6 from the field in Sunday's blowout loss to San Antonio.

Impact: Green has always been a shoot-first guard, and with the addition of Jack to the Hornets' bench, Green will play off the ball even more and see his meager assist totals even further reduced. Further, as Jack gets more acclimated, it would not be a surprise to see Green's minutes reduced slightly, thus hampering the little value he already holds.
News: With the addition of Jarrett Jack to the Hornets' backcourt, Green saw only 18 minutes in Monday's loss to the Clippers. He shot 4-of-7 for eight points but turned the ball over three times.

Impact: Jack had a good game despite a lack of practice with the team. He logged in 16 minutes in his first game, and as time passes and he becomes more situated with the team, he should be able to post respectable guard numbers. However, with Chris Paul logging the majority of the team's minutes at point guard, Jack's ceiling will be capped.
News: Jack performed well in his debut with the Hornets. He finished Monday's game with 12 points, four assists and three rebounds.

Impact: Mbenga was a free agent after playing 49 games for the Los Angeles Lakers last season. He averaged 2.1 points and 1.8 rebounds per game for Los Angeles and had his first career double-double against the Hornets early last season with 10 points and 12 rebounds. Mbenga also played in three games during the 2010 playoffs, averaging 1.7 points and 1.7 rebounds. He has no fantasy value.
News: The New Orleans Hornets have signed Mbenga.

Impact: He's got a shot to be on the roster opening night, but there's still no guarantee he'll make the team.  Pops is a physical player with good size, but he hasn't put it all together yet.
News: Pops Mensah-Bonsu has accepted an invitation to Hornets training camp, according to Yahoo's Adrian Wojnarowski.

Impact: The rebounds have been consistent as Okafor is averaging over 10 rebounds per game on the young season. However, after a strong preseason in which he showed an improved stroke, Okafor's free-throw percentage has fallen to 64 percent, just ahead of his career average of 59 percent, after he missed a pair on Monday.
News: Okafor offered little offensively, scoring only four points on 2-of-3 shooting, but snagged 12 rebounds and blocked one shot in 34 minutes of action Monday against the Clippers.

Impact: Paul has to be regretting the decision not to force a trade out of New Orleans over the summer at this point.  The Hornets are a mess on the court, and it's even messier off it.
News: Paul had 16 points and eight dimes, but only played 30 minutes in yet another Hornets blowout loss Sunday night.

Impact: Thornton is trying to earn his way back into coach Monty Williams' rotation these days, so be circumspect when evaluating this one game. It looks like the Peja Stojakovic trade could benefit Thornton -- he's averaged 14 minutes in the past three games after an eight-game stretch in which he had six DNPs. He's a more than capable scorer, but also needs to show more commitment to other areas of the game.
News: Thornton scored 11 points on 5-of-9 shooting from the field with one three-pointer, two rebounds and one assist in 20 minutes in Sunday's loss to the Spurs.

Impact: West may have preferred to sit out one more game as New Orleans was pummeled by San Antonio. West scored 13 points on 6-of-11 shooting with five rebounds, three assists, one steal and one block in 30 minutes.
News: West returned to the Hornets' lineup Sunday after missing one game because of the flu.

Impact: Anderson has averaged 7.0 points while developing into a 3-point shooter off the bench for the Spurs. The former Oklahoma State star scored seven points Wednesday night in a win over the Los Angeles Clippers. Anderson has made 10 of 20 from behind the 3-point line and was averaging nearly 18 minutes a game. He is scheduled for surgery next week.
News: Anderson has a stress fracture in his right foot that is expected to keep him out for two months.

Impact: Blair played 29 minutes on Sunday and is averaging roughly 20 minutes per game over his last five contests.
News: Blair had 10 points and eight rebounds in the Spurs' win over the Hornets on Sunday.

Impact: Bonner entered the game having made just one of his last 10 attempts from long distance. If he's not hitting threes, there's really no reason for him to be on a roster. After his 4-for-5 performance Sunday, Bonner is connecting on 50 percent of his three-point attempts for the season.
News: Bonner scored 14 points on 5-of-6 shooting, including four three-pointers, in 16 minutes in San Antonio's win over New Orleans on Sunday.

Impact: Duncan still did some damage in his part-time job Sunday, scoring 11 points with nine rebounds and three assists. Resting Duncan in games like this a preferred ploy of coach Gregg Popovich.
News: Duncan played just 19 minutes, sitting out much of the second half in Sunday's blowout win over New Orleans.

Impact: Ginobili's big scoring came in a game in which he didn't even play the fourth quarter. Manu is averaging more than 26 ppg over his last five contests, and with a date against the Clippers on Wednesday, expect that trend to continue.
News: Ginobili had 27 points, six rebounds and five steals in the Spurs' win over the Warriors on Tuesday.

Impact: Hill has scored in double-digits in seven straight games and seems to have figured out how to be consistently productive off the bench. Over his last five games, Hill is averaging 16.8 points, 2.6 rebounds, 2.2 assists, 1.0 three-pointers, and 2.0 steals in 32.2 minutes. Make sure he's owned in your league.
News: Hill had 20 points (7-12 FG, 1-3 3Pt, 5-7 FT), two rebounds, one assist, and a steal in 34 minutes off the bench Friday.

Impact: Jefferson is up in nearly every statistical category this year, but his 49% field goal percentage is the highest he's had in years.
News: Jefferson had 15 points and 10 rebounds in the Spurs' win over the Timberwolves on Friday.

Impact: Matt Bonner replaced McDyess in the lineup. McDyess should be good to go for the start of the playoffs.
News: Antonio McDyess sat out tonight's game versus Minnesota due to &quot;various bumps and bruises,&quot; according to Jeff McDonald's (San Antonio Express-News) twitter page.

Impact: Neal's averaging about only 14 minutes a night, but is getting off three 3-point attempts while converting 40 percent of the time. He has some value in a head-to-head format.
News: Neal scored eight points on 3-of-8 shooting, including 2-of-4 from three-point distance, in 21 minutes in San Antonio's win over New Orleans on Sunday.

Impact: Parker's success this season has mostly to do with his increased shooting ability, as he's making more than 51 percent of his shots from the field this season.
News: Parker had 19 points (7-10 FG) and six assists in the Spurs' win over the Hornets on Sunday.

Impact: Quinn has yet to play this season, but he should be able to find some minutes on the forsaken Nets after they released Alston earlier on Tuesday.
News: The Heat have agreed to trade guard  Chris Quinn to the Nets for a future second round draft pick, according to Yahoo! Sports. They are making the move to free up money to sign free agent Rafer Alston.

Impact: Signed in the afternoon, on the court that night. Udoka gives the Spurs a wing defender off the bench and someone coach Gregg Popovich is familiar with from Udoka's first stint in San Antonio from 2007-2009. He could get more minutes going forward as he assimilates with new teammates, but there won't be much fantasy value here.
News: The newly signed Udoka played three minutes in Wednesday night's overtime win over Minnesota.
